text: Absolutely the best sandwich and waffle fries.  Also a very fresh salad.  Ordered the club sandwich and southwest turkey sandwich both on fresh ciabatta.  Highly recommend.
Wow is I can say great wings and pitchers great price will be back absolutely recommed

Pros: The food is always good every time we come. We love the fact that this place offers Team Trivia during the weekends. Jake is a great server, and we have been served by the manager a handful of times - and he gave great service.   Now for the cons...  One server at the establishment, by the name of Izaak, was our server again tonight at Boulders. We all were within ear shot of each of his horrible comments he continued to make throughout the night. Directly behind our table he called us "shitty tippers" and as we were leaving he sneered at us and stated a derogatory comment wherein he said "fuck". As he picked up our tabs he had an angry affect and made a sarcastic "wow" statement while taking the bills away. Has it ever occurred to this person that they possibly do not get stellar tips (as we always make sure to tip even if we get awful service) because their service at times is rather mediocre? Talking shit about patrons in front of their faces is pretty damn unprofessional. If your service is mediocre, then your tip will be the minimum and you shouldn't be shocked about that.    This last night was honestly the last straw in regard to this poor service, and me and my friends will not be returning again. I am writing this review to give possible future patrons a heads up and let them know what might be in store for them.
Great experience. Food great. Service greater. Dessert was the greatest!  Stephanie was our server and she orchestrated a wonderful evening.

My boyfriend and I dined here tonight and I must say it was a pleasant first time! It took a few minutes to get our waiter, Isaac, to come over to us but once he did, we got everything going very quickly! He got our drink order and was very helpful with my modifications to a sandwich I had ordered! All in all, it was a great place to wind down and enjoy a tasty meal at the end of a long day! Definitely will be back!

This place is fantastic their food is awesome and their beer selection is always out doing itself. On top of all of that they are constantly hosting different activities to bring friends and family closer together. Come check out their schedule you'll probably find something that you want to join in on.

Great selection of beer and always a good drink special.  Probably has the best Pizza in the east valley.... definitely worth it for the pizza alone.  Other menu items are good, and portion sizes are generous. Not the best place to watch sports, but has an adequate amount of TVs, including some HD flatscreens.

Have been here way too many times to count. The food is delicious and they add new things to the menu every now and then to keep it interesting. We've tried the majority of the menu and the only thing I'd pass on would be the hummus or the 'Pasta Romanitco' - they're pretty meh.   The people are awesome, the servers are great (though there is more turnover lately) and there are a billion regulars that are more than happy to chat it up.   The beer list is extensive, as all the other reviews mention. The list isn't always up to date and the app they created to solve this problem usually isn't either or it's not working haha. But c'mon now, finding one you like really isn't that hard. Over all, it's a pretty awesome place with some unique food choices and wide array of beer options served by awesome people.

Good local bar that only serves craft beers. Have 30 on the list today, from a Pale Ale through a Oatmeal Stout. Most bar appetizers are average,  but the fried pickles are the best in Tempe. Also, have daily specials, just ask server. Sports on every tv. Good place to relax and do nothing.

boulders is great.   i will leave it at that.    you drive past it everyday ..   stop in    lots of beer . pizza is great too .   rest of the food is ok...     hardly ever crowded.   juke box is horrible however.
Fast, delicious, amazing. Use them for delivery all of the time. Chuck Norris double decker is recommended.... Unless you're a wuss

It was late Sunday night and not a lot of restaurants are opened in Tempe. Boulders on Broadway showed up on Yelp and has good reviews. They have an impressive selections of beers on tap, friendly and efficient  service. We all shared a Spinach artichoke dip, Big freaking nacho and California carver. The big freaking nacho is very interesting and good. The spinach artichoke dip is delicious. California carver pizza has grill onion ring toppings, very unique! I definitely recommend this place.

definitely need to get flat screens in the bar area, but thankfully the amazing selection of beers, and Alex and Dave's service, made up for the Analog Bears vs. Vikings game.    Did i mention all-you-can-eat one topping pizzas for only $7 on Sundays??  i was ashamed i could only make it thru 2 1/2... but they are huge!  unbeatable deal.  Rock!

This is one of the few establishments where the best thing about the restaurant is the staff! My wifi was having issues and I needed to complete an assignment. My boyfriend came along for the ride and thank god they had Sunday football to enjoy as I worked for hours. As for working for hours they accommodated my need for an outlet and followed with great service.   Order the $5 pizza special and it was a bit bland. Follow by wings with yummy sauce and finished with the apple cobbler. (Mmmhhhmm) Even though we were camping at a table and it was a bit busy we receive great service for hours.  I've been wanting to stop by this place for a while now and I very much approve of this pub! Great management ! 5 stars, despite the pizza.. But the hospitality won me over.

We ordered several appetizers and I wouldn't recommend any of them - spinach dip greasy with little spinach or artichokes, pizza bites tasteless, bruschetta very odd.  Skip the appetizers I guess - maybe the main dishes were better.

Not a big fan of the atmosphere and also not the best place to watch the game.  Food was nothing to rave about but my boyfriend did enjoy his wrap.Truthfully I felt the place was a little dirty. The service was slow but the waiters were friendly, at least most of them. I have had better!
Great beer selection and the burgers are tasty.  Very different selection vs your typical bar burgers. Nice work

The food and service was pretty good and the beer was delicious. HOWEVER, this is a local bar full of ignorant homophobic assholes and the patrons were less than welcoming to my girlfriend and I. LGBTQ and anyone with a working brain beware.

Good atmosphere, good service, and great beer selection! Clean, rotating taps and knowledgeable staff. The crowd is also diverse: some ASU bros, Tempe locals, tattooed punks, laid back stoners, and older couples. All around great place (though I have not tried their food).

I have not had beer here, but I'm not sure what all the fuss is about. It's beer. It comes from a tap or a bottle or a can. If you think that is an amazing feat worth writing about, come by and check out this killer lint I found in my navel. It's totally sweet. Bro.   The food was awful. I don't know how else to describe it. The group I came with ordered an assortment of things and we each tried a bit of the others food to confirm it was cold, bland and stale. I ordered a burger, medium-rare. It came overcooked and tasted like rubber. The bun was soggy. All the veggies on the burger were past their prime. It had no flavor. None. I tried adding ketchup and mustard and it did not help at all. I also ordered some Pepperoni Wheels. They were okay, but the marinara was off. It was chunky. Like salsa. Sort of. Large chunks of unidentifiable food stuffs floating in a vaguely red tomato-ish sauce. I ate two Wheels and that was enough. The ketchup was off too. It looked and tasted more like cocktail sauce. I don't know, maybe the staff was running on a lean mixture this day and muddled up the sauces. Who knows? I sure don't.   One of my friends ordered some wings. Those were not bad in my book, but she didn't like them at all. When you can still taste the vinegar over the hot sauce, I can see how it can be a turnoff.   I can't recommend this place. Never have I been in and out of a restaurant so fast before. We all got to-go boxes, which we promptly deposited into the outside trashcan by the parking lot.
Good spot for a pint. Not your usual Tempe bar.   They usually have an OK selection and I've never been let down by the service.   Go here and get a beer. (New motto for you guys... you're welcome)

How is it I never have written a review for this bar? I've been frequenting this place for, what, almost 8 years now since it changed over from Old Chicago? Has it really been that long?   Well, now I feel old. Anyways, Boulders has one of the best curated beer selections in the state, and it is staffed by some of the best bartenders in the country. The pizza recipes are solid, the California Carver is the go-to pie, but the signature hotdog selection will always hold a special place in my heart. "Hungover Man's Best Friend" lives up to the name. Sweet potato tots...sooo good...  Try the bloody mary or mi-monkey if it's still early, or choose a tap at random. You can't go wrong.

We love this bar. The beer, servers and food is awesome. The beer selection is spectacular and reasonably priced ($4 for a specialty beer). And they have PBR for $1.25!! The burgers they had this summer were great! Soooo delicious!.

Really laid back little bar.  They serve your typical bar food, but I was impressed with the quality.  Their beer list is the best!  We started coming to Boulders every once in a while after the Four Peaks Tasting Room closed and bumped into some of the friends we made over there.  If you like beer and excellent bar food, this is your spot.    The building is interesting and the people watching is even more so.  This is definitely a hippie/hipster/college kid hangout but everyone was so friendly, and I'm talking staff and patrons alike.  You can tell a lot about a place by the friendliness of the people who spend their money there.  It also definitely beats the crowds on downtown Mill Ave. or all the pseudo intellectuals hanging out at Casey Moore's.
Super amazing food and extensive beer selection! You can ride your bicycle right on inside. Friendly service. Basically this place feels like home, except better, because it never runs out of beer.

The service was decent and so was the food. I had the "Big Freaking Nachos" and they were good. I was pleased with them.  The atmosphere seemed to be really casual, but almost too casual.  The restaurant was really dark and seemed like it would be clean enough to pass inspection, but no more.  The bathroom was run down and had broken dispensers and a broken faucet.

I wish I could give no stars. Came in, the sign said seat yourself, we sat there for five minutes patiently. After several people noticed us and ignored us we asked for menus from the bar, 5 more minutes went by and still we were not greated! I work in the restaurant business and I could understand if they were busy or understaffed, but there were maybe 5 tables in the whole place an employee eating lunch at the bar. We walked out because your establishment clearly didn't want our money, so we spent it elsewhere.

Boulder's is awesome! I live within walking distance and come a few times a month at least. Food is delicious (the cookie is amazing), great variety of beers on tap, the staff is solid and really good at what they do. Trivia night is always a good time too. Definitely worth checking out if you haven't already been.

Given that my friends and I come here on a near weekly basis to play Team Trivia, I figured it was about time to write a review.  While I have some tiny issues with the place, they never matter much since I always end up having a blast here.    There are TONS of different varieties of beer available in bottles, cans, or on draft.  Perfect for beer snobs and craft beer noobs alike.  Even if you're like me and pretty much get the same thing (Ranger IPA!) every time, there are still lots of options if you decide you want to mix it up.  Plus, the happy hour prices rock.  Food is your typical bar fare.  Fried appetizers, burgers, and pizza.  I haven't tried the pizza yet, but I've enjoyed the burgers I've had.  On Saturdays, the burgers are $6 which is a smokin' deal, considering that one burger could probably feed two people, plus you also get a side salad or fries.  The guacamole appetizer is fantastic as well.  Great for sharing.  Now for the main draw, trivia!!!  Tuesday, Saturday, and Sunday nights, Boulders has Team Trivia games, which are fantastically fun.  If people don't cheat, that is.  My friends and I have won twice so far (winners get a $20 gift certificate for their next visit.)  Never fear if you're not the ultimate champions- second place and third place get $15 and $10 giftcards respectively.  It's always amusing to hear other team names with pop culture references and profanity peppered in.  The teensy negatives:  What's up with the A/C??  The last few times I've visited, it's been just stiflingly hot inside.  It hasn't been enough to ruin the fun, but it's definitely a bit irksome to sweat inside in the summer.  Service can also be slow at times but this is mainly when there are 30 trivia playing teams, so I understand the delay.  Generally, even when it's busy, the servers are awesome and do their best to get your orders to you quickly.

If you're looking for a super chill bar to sit, relax, and enjoy a few beers with friends, Boulders is the place. Started by avid rock climbers who used to be employed at the restaurant that formerly occupied the business space, this place is a Tempe gem.   Delicious food, a large drink selection, great happy hour prices, daily specials, and one of my favorite things to do while the night is young on Saturdays--Trivia.  Grab a group of friends, pick a horribly offensive team name, and get ready to play TRIVIA with some of Tempe's... smartest? Er-- People with as much useless random knowledge as you.  My only gripe is that this place can get HOT during the summertime depending on what area of the bar you're in. But hey, this is Arizona, you should expect this anywhere you go.

I've been visiting Boulders on Broadway two to four times a month for about two years now, so I'm glad to make them my first review. I suppose it's fitting since I was there twice yesterday - for the Spain/France soccer game, and later for trivia.  Beverage Selection - 1 Star / 1 Star Excellent selection of craft and import brews. Extensive bottle list and over 20 draft beers. The Konig is a great summer hefe.  Food - Vegan - .75 Star / 1 Star So, there's only three vegan items on the menu - guacamole, hummus (I order with veggies not pita), and a side salad. Normally, this would get a restaurant .25 stars. However, yesterday they made me a really delicious dish of sauteed veggies with balsamic dressing, which was allowed because the kitchen was slow. Thanks to Lauren, our server, and Matt the GM for making this happen. I really appreciate it!  It would be really great if there was a hot, vegan entree. I'd be happy to pay $8-$12 for something with sauteed veggies, a sauce/dressing, and two-three different proteins (beans, nuts, avocado, rice, pasta, hummus, etc.) I love the guacamole, but its not a proper dinner.  Service - 1 Star / 1 Star Again, thanks to Lauren, and Matt for the great dinner! Also, our server earlier in the day (shaved head, wears a hat) was really good. Thanks for the Konig recommendation. The service here is usually pretty good, even when its really busy for trivia. Be a considerate patron (if they're packed, and you've been there for two hours getting wasted, don't get mad when it takes a few minutes for the server to split up your check and run your card,) and you'll get great service.  Ambience - 1Star / 1 Star A bit farther from campus than Mill Ave, the bro/bro-ho ratio is pretty low. Trivia is awesome, happy hour is relaxing, and there's a really fun atmosphere during Suns games.  Also, this place is really bike friendly with racks inside and out, and a tire pump. There are two larger rooms for big parties and seating upstairs.  There's also a patio, which is great in the winter because it faces west.  Cleanliness - 1 Star / 1 Star The bathrooms are clean and always have tp/ paper towels. There was some pretty awesome bathroom graffiti, but I noticed its been painted over. Tables never sit dirty for too long.   4.75 stars overall

It's a great place to hang out on Friday and Saturday or even for lunch on the weekdays The bartenders and servers are great The food is nothing to write home about  and they have great prices for their  drinks         I would recommend this place to anybody

Hell yes! First of all, try the Higher Math beer, I've never tasted a beer like that, and it's 17% ABV, whew!!! I didn't get a chance to try any entrees, but I did try the jalape単o tots and they were good!! This place is worth checking out!

Love boulders! Has a very quaint and chill vibe. They also have a TON of beers to choose from! I always try to try something new when I come here. They have great guacamole that they make fresh! Also, I really like the burgers.

Food was excellent.  Had a bacon cheddar cheeseburger with fries for around ten bucks.  Best burger I've had in a while.  Our server was Lindsey and she was excellent.  Very attentive despite a very busy night.  Got a great deal on Groupon and will definitely be back soon.

Server was great; very attentive and excellent service.  The food was wonderful and the beer selection made me wish I had not gone for lunch.  Sunday, all you can eat personal pan pizza.  Thursday and, I believe Tuesday, are 1/2-priced bottles.  Great place.  Although the price is above $10, it is not much beyond that price/person.

This place is one of the best Tap rooms in town! If you are looking for a place to go for great craft beer, amazing selection and knowledgeable staff this is the place! If you are looking for a place to watch a game or have a meal that consists of more then bar food.......go somewhere else.

Out of towner looking for a good bar...WOW! What I found was a great bar, great food, great atmosphere, great beer choices! The bartenders, Justin & Dave made my wife and I feel like we were regulars, very helpful on both food and beer choices. We definitely have found our regular go to bar for spring training...and yes, my wife and I will adopt both of you Justin & Dave again thanks! Also let me not forget to mention Ben the manager, what a great guy to work with...Ben you rock!  Brian S. Monrovia CA

I love Boulders so much. Their food is delicious and their service is wonderful. There are so many different beer choices to choose from, and the happy hour is great. However, sometimes it can take FOREVER to get your food. So, if you're super hungry, I wouldn't recommend Boulders as your first choice. BUT I would most definitely recommend the place.

I was just thinking how long it's been since I've been to trivia on Tuesday nights and it made me sad.  I definitely need to get back into my trivia groove!  Other than missing trivia, I'm seriously craving some Jamaican Jerk Wings.  YUM!!  Not to mention the delicious guac that they'll make at your table if it's not too busy.    Great bar, one of my faves.  Great servers/bartenders and fun, come-as-you-are atmosphere.  Not a typical Tempe bar which is quite refreshing.
Love the beer list.   Foods good too.    Its a bar folks!
They change there wings, I didnt like the wings no flavor. The waiter didnt seem like she was good mood eiether. Last time I will come here, Been coming here for years.
I got the tacos and they were really good, brought my dog and our server gave her a cookie even though she was a bit of a brat that day.

This is by far the best bar in Tempe. They have an amazing selection of beer at a reasonable price and their staff is amazing. It is the best customer service that I have received. Their food is great and it  doesn't take forever to get it.

Primarily a pub and college student hangout. However, everyone was friendly and helpful and the sweet potato tots and thin crust pizza were excellent. Very friendly to bicycle riders. Indoor and outdoor seating. Many choices for beer.

I've been coming here for over 4 years now and they have grown a lot. Laid back crowd, as many beer choices as yard house but way better prices and unique dishes like dog fish head bruschetta make this place a rare find near the mill / old town area. On a personal note, thanks for continuing to be a member of trade source!

Met a buddy here for his b-day get-together. They had a decent selection of micro brews, and some good deals for happy hour on beer and some food. Their selections of beer are listed on the wall, so don't try looking for a beer menu.   I had a small pizza, which was pretty decent for the price. Ranger IPA was great, and only $2 for their big one (can't remember the exact size) during happy hour. They were pretty busy, but had a lot of servers working so we were being helped every few minutes. The pub itself is a dive, so if you like dives you'll like this joint.

Thoroughly disappointing. First time here. Uninterested and boring staff. Came to watch football playoffs and there was barely any volume so I was able to hear the table behind me chew their food. Seemed like a lot of regulars. Good beers on tap was the only redeeming factor I could find. I ordered the "Tangy Buffalo" style of their "Best Wings" it came out and I had to send them back because I didn't think there was anything on them except for a pool of grease under them. When they came back they were just a little more doused in greased "sauce" than the last but just as flavorless. The waitress did not not seem to care in the least. These were worse than Hooters mild sauce. They need to shape up but because of the good draft lineup I may give them a second chance.

Great place for some killer burgers in a laid-back atmosphere (probably about 70% ASU students to 30% families whilst we were there).  We have driven by this rather ho-hum restaurant countless times, but never thought to venture in (driving by you really would have no idea what kind of restaurant/bar/pub this might be!). Came across a Groupon and decided to give it a shot. Good decision!  We went at about 5:30pm on a Saturday and the place was about half-way full (more so in the bar compared to the "dining room").  Walk in, the sign says to seat yourself so we opted for a booth near a wall/window. Here's some advice:  Don't just plunk down in the booth, the seats could use a little TLC- they were rather hard!    Super chill and knowledgable staff; our waiter had great suggestions (we took his advice).  Started with a bruschetta appetizer (pesto, diced chicken, Gouda, basil, fresh tomatoes), which was hella tasty!  Margaritas were perfect blend of flavor and tequila, one is plenty for dinner unless you want to get tossed at 6pm. Followed up with the Moose Drool burger (did I mention that Saturdays are $6 burger or sandwich days, and includes one side?!?) which is a beef burger with provolone, fried onion strings, fried jalape単os and a jalape単o cream cheese.  Yum!    Still had some money to spend so we got their version of a pazookie, which was basically a very greasy, yet somehow still tasty, 9" freshly-baked cookie.   Bill came to $30, cheap!  Great place, REALLY great value on Saturdays!  Definitely recommend this place.

We've been to this location once, when it was an Old Chicago. We finally returned last night (6/17) to follow the Founders Brewing Co tap take over AZ tour. Despite being packed, the service was really good. That's all of the positives I have. It was hotter than heck and there was some serious price gouging going on. We've been to so many tap take overs I've lost count. I can't recall ever paying more than $9 for most of the beers. Boulders took full advantage of having some semi h beers and just marked it up to a deplorable price. $8 for 6.5oz of CBS is significantly higher than I've ever paid. $9 for  less than a full pint of KBS and Big Luscious...... SHAME ON YOU BOULDERS! Take some of your massive profits from last night and pay your a/c bill.

I used to really enjoy boulders, but my last few experiences have not been very pleasant.  The servers there have terrible attitudes, hence the reason I haven't been in a long time.  On my last visit I ordered the California carver pizza (usually very delicious) and I have had it many times.  This last time it was not made correctly so I asked our server (whom is also a bartender) for a side of sauce that is normally drizzled on it, which he replied "it's mixed in the pizza sauce, I guess I can grab extra" and proceeded to walk away. We all sat there stunned and asked why we still come here to each other.  Over the attitudes and the food has steadily gone down hill.

Staff is great, food is great, beer selection is super great.  They have PBR in a can every day all day for $1.25.  They have great daily beer and food specials.  The California Carver pizza is super unique and amazing.  Also, it is very bike friendly.  You can bring your bike in and hang it up inside, which is super nice for anyone who actually cares about their bike.  Everyone is super nice, they have tons of seating, tons of TVs with the games on, darts, and pool tables.  They also just added a new outdoor seating area where you can drink.  Trivia night is every Tuesday, and they have great live music every Wednesday.  I am a huge fan, and they deserve your business.  If you like good beer, good food, and good times, this is the bar/lounge/restaurant for you.

This place seems to have a bit of an identity crisis. It is a cross between a dive bar and a gastropub and it just feels a bit off. They have an impressive beer selection and the prices are decent too.   We sat on the patio with nobody else around and our dog was allowed to sit with us, so that is a bonus. Our server even brought out some water for the little guy. The downside is that we were approached a couple of times by people asking for money or food. The last thing I want to do is sit and try to enjoy myself as people repeatedly come up and ask me for handouts, so I knocked a star off for that.   All of the food we had was good but there wasn't anything that I would go out of my way to get. I will probably be back for a drinking lunch someday since I work nearby or to grab a beer that you can't find anywhere else nearby. Bottom line is that I'm neutral on this place - won't avoid it or go out of the way for it.
The service was terrible. We came so close to just walking out and the food was sub par
Went to Boulders this afternoon for Happy Hour.  The bar is a cool location and atmosphere with a great beer selection. I look forward to going back and trying more of there menu and drinks.

Everything went right with my experience at Boulders on Broadway.   Came in late evening on a Sunday, was able to seat ourselves in a spacious booth in a more quite corner of the pud, and was promptly greeted by our server.   The place was clean, well-lit (but not oppressively so), and the atmosphere was positive and upbeat. I loved how happy everyone was, and it was clearly a place for having a good time.   Our server was hilarious (almost crying at a couple of points) and he definitely made the night extra memorable. He was quick to top off our water, and made sure we were taken care of without being obnoxious. Kudos.  The food was excellent, making this my new favorite late-night stop for good ol' fashioned bar food. My wife and I split their Nachos Grande and it was amazing. Generous portion size, with all of the favorite toppings. They were baked in the oven to perfection and we scarfed them down with the help of our friend without even looking up.   I ordered the Elvis Calzone and was impressed. Cooked to a perfect golden brown, and stuffed with mozzerella, red bell peppers, and capers (normally comes with canadian bacon but I took the vegetarian route). Came with a huge side of house marina and it was hands down one of the best calzones I have ever had. Must try for calzone lovers.   Their beer list was staggeringly large, with every name you can imagine on it, and I was told that it changes daily. I wasn't drinking, so I didn't get to try any of the great selections, but it is definitely the place to be for those looking to try a new brew!!  Over all this place has great food, great service, and a killer atmosphere that makes a five star stop for anyone looking for an exceptional pub experience.

Boulders is a great place to have excellent beers on tap. There are always new beers to try. There is also really good quality food! My boyfriend and I go at least once a week. The staff is very friendly and always attentive. Also, the parking is WAY better than Four Peaks. I would definitely recommend Boulders to anyone. Five stars, no doubt.
One of the best places to eat. Food was awesome and a reasonable price. Our sever was so sweet and attentive. I think this is our new Saturday spot.
Calzone was great!  Service good. Place seriously needs a professional cleaning and a facelift.

Around 150 beers... team trivia... no nonsense. A cruisers paradise and and eclectic mix of people. Beer snobs and frat kids alike! You always find something you like with the super knowledgable bartenders/staff, and you will never feel out of place. I love love love this bar. There are different happy hours every night and Team Trivia on Tuesdays  Oh, ps. This is NOT a sports bar... there are handful of older televisions through the place so go to BWW if you're looking for a game.

Boulders is heavily involved in a lot of community events and for that, they have my appreciation.  Their beer selection is excellent, and their food is reasonably good.  However they perpetually under-staff table servers, making for very slow service.  It is not uncommon to wait for 20 minutes for a simple drink order.  I can't speak to bar service, but eating at a table Boulders is an all-evening affair.  It doesn't do a lot of loud music, but it gets crowded at times and the noise level makes it a bit excessive.  Sitting in the upper level is usually quieter.  That said, it is not a bad place.  You could certainly do a good deal worse for bars in Tempe.  They have a good community of cyclists and climbers, and you can often meet interesting people.

PINE NUT BLEU CHEESE SALAD was the BEST salad I've ever had in any restaurant on any of the four continents to which I've traveled. The thinly sliced pears were in perfect harmony with the bleu cheese. The vinagrette added just the right notes of tang and sweetness. Highly recommended.

Just touched down to AZ from Cali so finding some good is important to me . After the long drive I took a look at their Happy Hour menu at 11 pm and ordered Unicorn Tears, Onion Rings, 2 diefferent hamburgers fr their menu. Grandma had a side Caesar salad. We all left super full and happy and our this was quenched at this cool hip restaurant.   I yeah cool outside patio! ! Missstyyy!

This place might have one of the best beer selections at a reasonable price in all of Tempe. Possibly in the East Valley. Their food is great too, service is decent, and the daily specials they offer are just plain awesome!

My boyfriend and I just wanted somewhere to eat and we didn't know this was more of a dive bar.  We don't really care for beer, so we didn't have any.  When we first got there our hostess sat us at a dirty table.  The menu was dirty as well and there was no menu for beer (which seemed to be their highlight).  Our waitress was the worst of the night.  She had no personality, was rude and didn't understand humor.  All the workers, excpet one, I believe the owner, had no energy.  They looked unhappy and really uncustomer service friendly.  There was also a gross bathroom smell near where we sat in the booth.  Well, past that our food looked good, but tasted pretty much flavorless.  It wasn't really worth the money we paid for it.  We were ignored mostly and any refill, ketchup request seemed like it was too hard of a task.  Learn the hell to smile!  We were so uncomfortable there!  Terrible terrible times more terrible!
Great atmosphere and sign up for their loyalty card and not only will you get great happy hour specials but even better specials on top of that. good food and good beers on tap!

I absolutely can't stand this place, but routinely there are special beer events that cause me to frequent it. Beer selections are great, albeit over priced even for non rare beers. Food is mediocre at best. Service is awful.   My first time there was for a beer event that was very busy and service was lousy. I chalked it up to the event stretching everyone thin.   Came back on a normal night where it wasn't nearly as packed and watched servers stand around neglecting tables all night. Food was cold, but the beer was too.  Came back a few times for rare beers and had the same experience. Today was the last time I think I'll come in even for the special tapings. The manager or owner (don't know which but he is always there) was extremely rude to me when filling my beer and I can only assume it was because I was purchasing a full beer instead of taking part in the beer festival event they had going on at the time. I guess my money for the beer wasn't enough compared to the other patrons.

Visited Boulders again this past Monday to partake of a few craft brews & have a bite to eat.  I had a Stone IPA & a Rogue Dead Guy Ale, both on tap.  I'm told it was the hottest day of the year but it was Bloody uncomfortably Hot inside as well.  Thank god for the cold beer!  We had Italian Nachos, Veggie Style, to match our beers and all was good in the world.  My only complaint was the inside tempature, in the Arizona Heat, this is an important detail! Lets hope they fix this little bug!

Ok where to start... I come here every week... I love the atmosphere, they offer a great happy hour... the food is really good.... they even have trivia... but the problem is the service with a certain server named (IZAAK) he is very rude, he disrespected me and my whole table and I felt humiliated.. he would whisper under his breath really rude comments.. I really love boulders but he needs to be confronted about this issue and work on his people skills! I might not be returning to boulders....

Here's the deal.  I'm not even going to review the "food".  No.  This is devoted to the fries.  Listen... the food is pretty good.  I could think of some things to do better, but as it stands I would never shy away from an opportunity to eat here.  I fear the sandwiches are being overshadowed by the fries.  Oh... the fries.  Nuggets from God himself.  Nuggets from Allah.  NUGGETS FROM THE BETTER PART OF THE AFTERLIFE! (And if you don't believe in the afterlife, then... uhhh... nuggets from Dawkins?) Seriously.  I long for those fries.  Oh, I had the pizza one time.  It was good.  Not as good as the fries, but... you know, shadow of the colossus syndrome and all... good.
This place doesn't open on time so I can't give it much of a review . I was really excited to try it but got tired of waiting .

I love this place! We go here about once a paycheck! We bring our kids sometimes and even the mother-in-law a couple of times. This is a great place to meet your friends and hang out. Everything on the menu that I have tried has been great! The Stromboli and the salads are my favs! I've never had to wait to be seated. And the wait staff has always been more than pleasant.

Been going here for years and i can still say I'm a fan.  the ONE thing I don't love is that they don't have beer lists readily available at tables, because they want you to download their app. it's just an extra step that i'm not into at all. if i didn't already have the investment in boulders, it would honestly make me think twice about going there. I'm just not a fan of making that app replace lists at the tables.   other than that, solid atmosphere, decent bar food. I can sincerely say that the quality of service there varies GREATLY from server to server. it seems like some really want their customers to be happy and others just sort of want to make it through the day.   the bartender who i think is named Chris takes his job seriously and always has good recommendations. Also, can't say enough nice things about their waitress Stefanie. I typically try to sit in her section if I can look around and see if she's working. Everyone there is nice and pleasant, I just feel like I get better service from these two in particular.   Tuesday trivia still as fun as ever. Their hot wings are also delicious, though I wish there were a little bit crispier.

I love this place. Been coming here since it was Old Chicago. I miss the 'round the world' beer thing that OC had, but so what... Boulders reminds me of OC but even better. Great food, great staff, a crowd that is a nice mix of students and other folks. A real neighborhood bar with just enough college vibe but not so much that anyone over 30 feels painfully out-of-place. Came in recently with a big group, we sat upstairs and the service was a tad tardy but I completely understood, we didn't realize how big our group would be. They shanghai'd extra wait staff to keep us all happy and I gotta say we WERE happy. Love the big-ass nachos and hell, pretty much everything there.  The only complaint I would ever have about their food, is that recently I had some kind of stuffed burger and the meat just was not cooked thoroughly enough, and it took so long to get my order that I really wasn't about to send it back and wait even longer.  But, hey, shit happens sometimes. This is by far the exception there. I will keep coming back, love ya Boulder's! If only you could open up one by my area of Phoenix!
This place is always so amazing! They let you bring your dog onto he patio. The salmon blt with the waffle fries are on point! Staff is super nice and welcoming!

Accommodating, Enjoyable, Delicious & Connected.  P.S. Start with their "Classic Bar Stuff" (Fried zucchinni, cheese curds, onion strings  & wings); then fill up on the Moose Drool Burger! Thanks Erick

There are so many things right about this place it should be wrong. The heaters outside for the patio area are even fantastic. I went on Halloween this year, and everyone was dressed up, it was quite amusing. The building appears to be built into the side of a hill, so there aren't any windows, this kinda gives the place a darker- shadier feel. However, their alcohol and beer selection is pretty amazing. The person I was with was pretty impressed, and I've had friends talk about this place often.   We had hamburgers stuffed with pepperoni, cheese, mushroom, and other pizza toppings. They were a bit dry, but still delicious, I recommend trying one of the burgers, for sure. The burchetta was by far the best appetizer I've had in a long time. The guy taking our order disappeared a few times, so it took us a long time to get our check and food, but if you're having drinks that won't be noticeable.

All around great experience, great atmosphere, and great food. I had the Carver burger, solid choice, great amount of spice and a great amount of all around flavor. If you are looking for a place to get some solid bar food then this is the place for you!

Best part: loved the beer list. Lots of delicious and unique craft brews. Looks like there are some great brewery events here, signed up for the email list and hoping to catch a few. We were here late on a busy Friday night with a group of six. There was one table left that we were able to squeeze around. We ordered some late night food - sandwiches, burgers, nachos, sweet potato tots. We all felt like the food was fine, but just fine. Everything could have been a little better. Our friend's burger was ordered med-rare and wasn't really pink at all. The breakfast menu looks pretty promising. I guess we'll have to try some food here during regular meal hours. Very friendly service.
Cool atmosphere. A lot of beers on tap and good food. Went on a Saturday and they have a great food deal and drink specials!

Amazing selection of beer! Good specials, too. I was able to find my favourite Maui Brewing Company Mana Wheat here which made my day! The food is very good and portions are more than ample so you can easily split something or just have a lunch for yourself the next day. Service is really friendly and the vibe in here is really relaxed and fun. I came in after a race and didn't feel at all out of place in my racing gear and all sweaty and tired. My new favourite post-race place!
Went to Boulders tonight.  Put 5 dollars in the jukebox, requested 4 songs.  Bartender skipped every single one of them.  If you don't want your customers to play music, don't have a jukebox.

I wish there was a setting for ZERO stars, as this place fits the bill big time. Handedly the worst service I've ever had. As briefly as possible, I ordered food for delivery. 90 minutes later it wasn't here so I finally called (should have earlier). The employee told me she didn't take my order so she couldn't help me, and she then hung up...seriously?! I then called back, and asked for the manager, and the same employee said she was the manager and couldn't help me, then she hung up again.  So I called a 3rd time and demanded to speak with the real manager.  Surprisingly, or not, the manager then treated me the same way. My food finally showed up as I was on the phone with the manager, 100 minutes after I ordered. Because it got there, the manager refused to refund me, and refused to acknowledge that her superbly sub-par employee was out of line.  No person should ever, ever hang up on a customer, period.  Oh, and the food was also sub-par.  Avoid at all costs. I wish this experience on no one, even the orange haired guy.

Boulders is one of my favorite lunch spots during the week- it's close enough I can get there during my lunch hour, and not very busy at that time of day so we can get our food quickly.  I get the Honey BBQ Chicken Salad (with no onions! ...no onion?) every time.  My coworkers have ordered a variety of different lunches, and gave two thumbs up to those too.  They have a large beer selection for my beer-drinking friends and really tasty root beer for me!  I haven't been for happy hour or at night for drinks, but I'd like to!

Enjoyable place. No frills, very comfortable place to hang out. Good food and a great beer list.  Outdoor seating if you're in that mood, lots of TVs inside for sports. Great service. Why wouldn't you come to Boulders on Broadway.
Great staff and food and drinks but always hot inside. If you haven't had them the crispy artichokes are awesome!! Fans or extra cooling could help a lot in the bar area.

I give Bonnie G full credit for me reviewing this place, for there'd be no way in hell I'd have seen it or known about it otherwise. I'm trying to remember why we went. Somehow I was in Tempe. Bonnie was in Tempe. Why were we both in Tempe? Who knows. You don't care either way.  The point is, walking into Boulders was a little bizarre. It's completely out of place for the area. More like an old college institution you'd find in Chico or Corvallis. Or maybe even Flag. Big, huge, bike-friendly wooden ski lodge. Upstairs loft with pool-table overlooking the bar/restaurant below. It is pretty much the quintessential neighborhood hangout. No scene. No pretense. No slathering your fake-n-bake and hair gel to mack on Landon and Tiffany. Extremely casual and everyone's friendly - from the owner to all the other patrons.   And did I mention the beer? An impressive selection of microbrews on tap, many of which I'd never heard of. But the owner took the time to describe each one, and I ended up with a few pints of a really great stout (Bonnie was quite taken with her brew as well). The beers regularly rotate, so there's always something new to try.  And sure, there is mostly noise coming out of the jukebox, but I didn't really care. It's not like I was expecting to hear some European DJ who has at least one umlaut in his name and wears wraparound shades even while he's spinning in a pitch black nightclub. You're here for the conversation (unless you're a Woo Girl).  So all in all, I really dug this Boulders, in all its sheer normalness. We all need a place like this: a super-casual neighborhood bar which requires the least amount of effort from you. Sitting on your living room couch and feel like having a beer with a friend without needing to put on "going out" attire and "going out" attitude? This is it. Your shoulders are down. You're chilled out. And you're probably discovering a new favorite beer in the process.  4 stars.

This used to be my and my boyfriend's favorite local spot. Then they changed their menu, their all-day happy hour schedule, and we haven't seen our favorite server in a month. They took away their best burger, the Tatonka, their best appetizer, the Buffalo Chicken Dip, and one of their best sandwiches, the Ro' Diddy. They also changed all-day happy hour from Saturday to Sunday. Before this, they took away my favorite breakfast item from weekend brunch, which was this great twist on scrambled eggs on a hot dog with bacon, green peppers and jalape単o cream. It was called the Hangover Man's Best Friend that went really well with sweet potato tots. Then we never saw Izaak after all these changes took place. The new servers didn't take the time to get to know us like Izaak did. It's unfortunate. I took away a star for every item they took off, +1 for being awesome before all these changes, and +1 because Izaak was/is the best. Our last hope was the sister restaurant on Southern, Boulders on Southern, but alas, to no avail. They had the same changes. Our tradition must now change, and we are seeking a new local spot.

After climbing at AZR last night, Taylor and I were deciding where to get our drink on...  We jetted down to Boulders for wings, good beer (Arrogant Bastard) and pool.  This place is so hip to the outdoor life that they have Climbing mags to read while waiting for the food to arrive!  Any bar that has Dogfish Head, Chimay, and Moose Drool is a winner in my book.  Even saw Yelp royalty here, Taylor F. was lounging with Jen and Tim!   I will be back.....  Oh, and it is definitely the place for shorts and flip-flops on a Friday night!  One last note - great jukebox...

This place is awesome and one of my favorite places to drink and eat. Boulders has awesome customer service with a great vibe.  I had ordered delivery one night through Tempe takeout and Tempe takeout decided to cancel my order 40 minutes after being placed because they did not have a driver in the area.   I called Boulders explaining what happened and spoke to a manager. Boulders told me they could have my food ready in less then 10 minutes if i wanted to pick it up.  Went to Boulders with my order ready to go and half off my bill because Tempe takeout screwed up. Thank you Boulders!

Terrible. Ordered a bacon cheese burger medium rare more rare. Add onions & mushrooms. Came super well done like crispy bacon only no bacon. Onions had breading on them and no mushrooms but jalapeno peppers instead. Trying to not complain I asked for mushrooms. (I forgot the bacon). Mushrooms came after 15 minutes. I picked off all the peppers. Took one bite but it was saturated in jalapeno pepper juice so I went discretely and told the manager. All he offered was to delete the sandwich from the bill but no offer to make me another. The water tasted like unfiltered crap Arizona tap water. I could not drink it.  I paid for my beer and left and went somewhere else to eat. Never again. Avoid this place. Food & service is terrible.
Boulders is great! So many craft beer options on tap and tasty food! :)

Great place to grab a beer!  The selection is fabulous. The staff is kind aloof but friendly.  The atmosphere is very casual, relaxed and kinda hippie.  I've been twice. The first time was on a Saturday night. The place was packed for trivia and emptied out quickly after the game.  I shared the honey chicken sandwich with a friend and it was quite good. The waffle fries were delish too.  The second time was a Sunday afternoon for the all you can eat one topping pizzas for $7 per person. I got green chilies as my topping and loved it. It the pizza gourmet? No. Is it a great pizza for the price? Yes! I powered my way through 1 1/2 pizzas and took home the leftovers.  Make sure you bring your appetite!

Great place to chill after work and take back a few amazing beers with your friends. They have a great selection of craft beers on tap and bottled. There's definitely a lot I'll need to try. The staff is friendly and their happy hours are generous. I'd recommend it easily.

Okay, okay...so, we went back, and we were convinced. A couple friends and I were looking for a place to watch Sunday football, and we came here for the first games of the season. It was a quiet morning, but probably just because it was the first game. It has definitely picked up since then.  Justin, the Manager, was kind enough to lure us back with an offer to try the California Carver pizza. Hooked! ! Comes with a spicy southwest sauce, turkey, pepper jack & mozzarella, then topped with pico, avocado & crisp onion strings. You won't be sorry you tried it. We went back the following week and ordered the same thing!  We've gone back a couple times now and it feels like we're visiting with old friends when we come in. Justin, the bartender, is a riot and knows how to keep his customers smiling even when he's got a full bar - plus it helps he's also rooting for DaBears!   The service really has been excellent, everyone is on top of things and makes sure we have everything we need. They probably don't remember this, but I also hosted a dinner for my Meetup group in the private room upstairs a few months ago, and we had great service then too. I was just so busy entertaining, that I didn't get a chance to really talk to the staff that night...but we'll probably host another event here soon!  Thanks Justin1 for convincing us we needed to come back, and Justin2 for making it fun to stay. See you for the next Bears game! ;)

I went here one weekday night with my team from work, and it was alright. We had a big group and ended up sitting outside, which was nice during the time of the year that we went. The drinks were fine. The service was fine. The food was fine. I guess I could see the colorado-y charm during the brief moment I stepped inside. It had a very lodge-y feel.   It wasn't very memorable In fact, I hadn't though about this place until I was searching on yelp for restaurants. I probably wouldn't go back especially since there are places like Four Peaks and Cornish Pasty nearby.

UPDATE: I received an apology from the owner regarding the salad error. I will be returning to give Boulders another shot.  -The "Pizza Nuggets" are just a cut up cheese pizza. Not a big fan. Kinda doughy.  -Ordered the California Carver Burger which was really good.  -I chose a house salad for my side with the burger, which was on the list of options along with the waffle fries and caesar salad.  However, when my bill came I was charged $3.50 for the salad, which is the full price for the house salad. I didn't receive any other side with my burger and, after double checking the menu, no where did it say anything about an extra charge for a salad. I'm not someone who makes a fuss, especially over $3.50, but when I asked the waiter about it his response didn't make any sense. All he said were things like "the manager makes us do that" and "it's so stupid" and that "the caesar salad doesn't come with an extra charge, but the house does." He did end up taking it off, but the fact he made up a bunch of excuses that didn't make sense left us all confused.  Enjoy the good food, but be sure to review your check carefully!!

As you can see from my check-ins, I have become a regular @ BOB.  They have greatly improved on their service (much appreciated)!  My friends and I have returned multiple times for their nachos and pizza! I also have ventured out and tried their Tree Huggin' Veg Head and Spinach Artichoke Calzone - all good.  Make sure you catch Happy Hour during the week to take advantage of their drink and appetizer specials! They have Wi-Fi and the music they play is also really good! SOLID! :)

It's definitely a locals hang & the beers are cold & are cheap anytime of the day. Gotta love that! If you're looking for some amazing fare or to hook up with someone avoid this place because the food in my opinion looked meh & the peeps were very chill. Not a Tempe meat market & I love that!
Great food, good deals, amazing beer. Be sure to come early on trivia nights (Tu, Sa, Su)

What's not to love about Boulders? Cool, friendly staff. Dozens of craft beers - importantly coupled with some true, in-house expertise on the subject. Great food, especially the pizza. Excellent weekly specials. Prime location with plenty of parking.  And, of course, there's...The Big Freakin' Nacho.   The BFN is truly the most unusual, potentially frightening and ultimately satisfying nacho-type dish I have ever utterly failed to finish, even with the assistance of multiple friends. It is served on a pizza platter.  A LARGE pizza platter. Enough calories to support a small Eurasian village through a long winter. And, oddly but pleasantly, the chips are made from fried pizza dough, and marinara has been subbed in for salsa.    An experience worth having.

Service is bogus!  Although Boulders has a decent beer selection, they present their drawls in a difficult fashion. Who advertises their selection through a time lapse television screen?!  The food was sub par at best. I find this place to be a disgrace to nachos (haha). Add chicken? Ask first. The menu price is less than is charged. I spoke to the manager (who we all thought was a server in training) after they tried to swindle us and were told "We are waiting on new menus. Next time you will be charged the full amount." Wtf? Charge the prices that you have listed on your menu or.... Well, you're a dick.   The vibe of the place seems legit. I just wish they ran a good show.

Okay, so a group of us go out practically every Friday to the same old places for beer and food, but mostly for beer. So to break out of the norm, I was in search of a place with excellent beer and good food and somewhat close to home. So onto Yelp I go and came upon Boulders, and the reviews were pretty good and definitely worth checking out. So we all pack into the car and head over to Boulders. The parking is great, plenty of spaces to go around. You walk through the patio, not bad with all the misters, felt like I was in a rainforest, but very refreshing. So you walk a little further, watch the steps, and there's your bar. Very open, plenty of hightop tables and lots of TV's. The beer menu was plentiful. It should make everyone from the microbrewer to the coors drinker happy. I was pleased because they had plenty of vegetarian meals, or dishes you can substitute meat for veggies... and for you meat eaters out there, I was told the burgers were delicious and the waffle fries were soooo tasty. The staff was helpful and attentive as well. I would definitely add this into our Friday night rotation. If you're looking for microbrews, this is a place to check out. The atmostphere is kicking and just an all around good place to kick back.

This place is perfect for riding a bike to and grabbing a bite and few beers. I love that they have indoor bike racks viewable from the bar; a perfect feature for people like me who always forget my lock.   They have pretty fantastic drink specials and a solid craft beer list. All September they're doing $3 Oskar Blues cans. They also do all day happy hour on Saturday's, half price pizza on Monday's, and Trivia Night on Tuesday's & Sunday's.   I can't say the food is anything worth writing home about, but for what they offer they do it well & the service has always been great. All around a good place!

As we arrived I noticed a catering truck with the Boulders on Broadway AND "Spokes" restaurant written across it.  Since we've not had great experiences at Spokes we said "Let's just hope this place is better" as we walked in BonB.  'Ordered boneless chicken wings and wound up with deep fried (we expected grilled), that with at least half of the wings being mostly fried breading...ugh.  'Also ordered a Swiss Mushroom burger/medium - came out well done and the meat didn't taste fresh.  I'm surprised there are numerous good comments about the burgers here. The piped in music (from a radio station), was annoying - too loud and not clear. What I can give a good review on is our waitress. We'll not give this place another chance.

This place has a great beer selection and good specials like half off bottled beers on Thursdays if u are a club member... Do it, register its easy! The food is your typical bar fare. They have their version of a pizza cookie (half bake topped with ice cream) not nearly as good as the original from Oregano's... Sorry I name dropped. Over all great location, younger college crowd, laid back atmosphere, and really good service!
Good stuff...typically go here after a Phoenix hike!!  Creative menu items at a good price.  Plenty of sports on the TVs!!

Boulders on Broadway has been one of my infrequent go-to's ever since moving to the Tempe area about two years ago. It's a very consistent experience, albeit a somewhat expected one.  The beer menu is pretty good - not great, but better than other bars in the area. The menu is also pretty good - plenty of yummy options, nothing necessarily earth-shattering.  My typical order is the California Carver Burger, which is always really tasty, and my FAVORITE thing about the place is that they serve DELICIOUS waffle fries. can't get enough go those!  Service is always also "just ok". Nothing to write home about in all the times I've been there, although certainly acceptable. Everyone's typically pretty busy, to be honest.  The ambiance is nice for a bite to eat or to grab a drink with a friend, but I never bother bringing my laptop or anything - there are better bars (and coffee shops!) for that.  The one minor complaint I have about Boulders is that waiter service can sometimes be outrageously slow. Getting your food: can also sometimes be unbelievably slow.  The only reason I make mention of this is so that you don't expect to squeeze a "quick lunch" in if you're on the clock. You'll likely go over (been there, done that, I'm afraid...).  Overall, I'd give Boulders on Broadway 3 stars. BUT... Because they serve those tantalizing waffles fries that keep me coming back... I'm happy to give them 4 stars instead.  :)

Went for lunch yesterday and had an AMAZING meal!!!  I went for a work meeting and between the two of us, we tried: the pulled pork sandwich, the bacon cheeseburger, the waffle fries, and the jalapeno cheese tots.  I cannot say enough how delicious this all was!!!  The pulled pork was great, loved the slaw and pickles.  The waffle fries were crispy and delicious!  The bacon on the cheeseburger was amazing!  But most of all, the tots!!  OMG the tots!!  If I hadn't been there for work, I would have taken pics.  It was great.  Service was also fast and stellar, our server was awesome.  The beer menu was incredibly impressive, so had it been after 5pm, I would have had a different time  All in all, great bar food and drinks...highly recommend...will definitely be back.   Side note:  the door is on the side of the building
Very good Music, good atmosphere for family conversations had the BBQ chicken Salad awsome Meal with my family visiting from out of Town,

The food here was really good, and you really need to take them seriously when they say "Big Frickin' Nachos". Those things were huge! 4 of us couldn't even put down before we got the entres. The only thing I didn't like about the place was the service time. It took a while to get drink refills and we were waiting for the check for too long.

The food was okay but our server, Izaak, was incredibly rude to us. We caught him whispering mean comments behind our backs and even as we were leaving the restaurant. We saw him treat the other tables fine but I guess he just didn't like us.  It made our experience incredibly uncomfortable and we don't plan on going back there again.

Oh Boulders,  you have made me proud. handsome Dave turned it all around for me and i come weekly with a group of hungry, thirsty ladies for our official "meetings".  From Addya to Dave to Poopsie to Amy, we just keep gettin it good and keep comin back. Your food runner is top notch and a great idea! The mgr (I think) comes out to show us baby pics as if we were part of the Boulders fam even if we dont climb or ride. The patrons have become less, erm, gangstah and more neighborhood. I am so pleased this neighborhood cove found its way to realizing the fortune this hood can provide, given the right prices, decent food, a chill patio and good service. I could see Boulders expanding that patio and raking it in, should the city be as kind as to let them. One thing- chilly months? Do away with the cool, fancy looking heaters that dont work and do more with the other version. The fire pit is a great touch but it runs out often. Other than that, I hope you appreciate how amazing your core staff is. They are largely why we keep coming back!

I've been a regular customer of Boulders on Broadway for 4+ years.  Over that time, my friends and I developed relationships with the wonderful servers there, who always remembered our names, our favorite dishes, and who were always willing to recommend a great new beer from the extensive, ever changing list.  In the past year or so, however, this place has gone downhill fast.  The online beer list never matches the beers on the chalkboard, so it's hard to order without checking with your server about what's ACTUALLY going to be on tap.  They also no longer have prices posted, so more than once I have been surprised by ordering a "premium" beer when no indication of this was given on the menu.  Unfortunately, in our past 3 visits, we've sat for 15-20 minutes before actually being visited by a server.  On one occasion this summer, I found a fly in my salad.  Their employee turnover has also been unreasonably high as of late...gone are those friendly servers who remembered our names and made us feel welcome.  In the past year, we've had a different server on every visit, and every time they seemed brand new (didn't know the beer list, forgetting our order, etc.).  The final straw was that in our last two visits, the servers have been not only incompetent but downright rude, even insulting people at our table to our faces.  Sorry Boulders...based on our history, I've given you too many chances.  No more.

Went their while my car was being fixed. Asked for what beers were on tap but was told they were on the wall, do descriptions of the beer. TV's are small. Ordered the wings off the appetizer menu and had them with buffalo-tangy sauce. Probably thee worst wings I've ever had. Sauce was awful, the wings sat in its own grease, I had to remove them from the basket to eat them. I didn't even finish them all. I'll give this place another chance for dinner.

I've been to the Mesa location many times and have been very happy so I tried the Tempe location today when I was in the area.   The service was nice, pleasant, and quick, and the food was decent (but it wasn't hot when it came out). However, the restaurant felt very dirty, which kind of ruined the experience.

I've now been to "Boulders on Broadway" twice and think it's definitely worth you checking out.  The first time I came in with my wife, we weren't thrilled with the food, but the second time I came in, I sat at the bar and had the Carver Pizza, which was delicious.  Great service, too.  One huge plus - their prices are GREAT.  The Happy Hour is excellent, and they have Happy Hour ALL DAY on Saturday.  That's insane.  $4 Appetizers and Drinks, not to mention the Burgers and Pizzas are affordable as well.    If you're an ASU student, or really, anyone who wants to find a good deal on food and drinks, and if you like Pub Trivia, then I say...  ENJOY!

Was recommended by a friend . I was not expecting BEST WINGS EVER!!!!! It is a hipster place with TONS of seating and great burgers and wings. Great service, could be faster offering refill on my drank, but I'm a wee impatient sometimes and it was Thirsty Thursday after all.  They have private room for parties  and many craft brews of every sort.  Bike and car parking and pretty fun time.

UPDATE:   I received a very friendly message from the owner of Boulders, who apologized for my previous experiences with the food, and offered a free meal with recommendations. Instead of using the free offer from the kind owner, I went back to the restaurant and ordered BOTH of the suggestions that he had: The Asian Bob burger, and the California Carver pizza.  The burger was incredibly juicy and had a nice balance of sweet and savory. Two thumbs up.  The pizza was a crazy amalgamation of all that is yummy: Pepperjack cheese, onion strings, pico de gallo, turkey breast. The serving size was more than adequate for a single person and the taste was great!   Add these two great menu choices with the endless (and ever changing) beer selection, and Boulders on Broadway is a hit!

A rare treat . . . the new weekend only breakfast at Boulders On Broadway . . . 9am-Noon.  A small menu, but interestingly thought out.  They need to get it up on their website and highlight it!  I'll be back to try the others . . . the Chuck Norris looks good, and I've heard evangelical things about something involving a hot dog . . .  but I've had the Arizona French Toast. Longboards of french toast baugette with candied jalepenos, powdered sugar.  Comes with AZ honey, but I got syrup instead, and added a side of bacon.  Add Four Peaks Brewery's Hop Knot IPA in a frozen glass. Fantastic. The candied jalepenos . . . sweet with plenty of heat, seems wrong but it was SO right . . . I believe I'm ruined for any other french toast

If you like Trivia nights and a wide beer selection this place is for you.  If you hate Trivia nights and want a fancy drink this place isn't for you.    The food that we get there are usually the burgers and fries which are great.  The pizza isn't too bad and recommend the thin crust over any of the thicker pizzas.    I recommend the SW Chicken Quesadilla and it is somewhat spicy.  The steak sandwhich is literally the best sandwhich I've ever had and my wife agrees.   The salads are hit or miss; I've had one good salad and two pretty horrible iceberg lettuce based ones so avoid the salads as they always seemed a little wilted.    Go there if you have a party of about 5 max as its kinda hard to find seating during Trivia nights.  I hosted my birthday there sometime ago and rented out the upstairs.    To sum up: great location; great people and great bar.  It would get a 5th star if their upstairs was more developed and they hosted real, live music instead of the brutal jukebox.

So to start off, I'd like to speak only about my experience, not the quality of food or service... Wow.. It almost became funny how bad the jukebox selections were..we had 2 females wearing red bandanas and cut offs choosing axial rose and Bon jovi songs for 2 hours.. Jesus help me, then the food came., blah. Wings should be bomb where there is beer. Instead they were just coated in a very strange sweet ketchup sauce they called honey BBQ. I tried this place only because it was 11pm n still serving.. I'll eat cereal next time..

We live very close to this place, and have considered it a few times just never committed until the other day. I got the groupon (pay $13, get $25) and the 5 of us went in. It was empty on a Saturday afternoon. LOTS of seating inside. From the look of the outside I was nervous it'd be kind of gross inside, but it's not. Could use some updates, but it's clean. Service was friendly, although our waitress wasn't overly knowledgable about their beer selection.   You MUST get the nachos. OMG - so delicious. The chips must be deep fried so they're almost like wantons. SO good!! The pizza wasn't that great, doughy, so I'd try something different next time/wouldn't recommend that. They have waffle fries and tots to choose from! Burgers looked good, same with the sandwiches. LOTS of menu choices so you won't go hungry :-)

Pizza was great. Bike friendly. Service was fast and efficient.  We arrived midday which is not the best time to miss the cleaning crews, but the pizza lived up to its reputation.  I'd come back here for the bar meets 1970's fern pizza joint meets bicycle shop ( for the racks indoors, not that it has a service shop ).  My father-in-law loved the place which is a hard thing to compliment positively about eating out.  Maybe it was the Tempe heat that helped him mellow out.

I love love love boulders on broadway!!! I'm from out of town and visiting and came twice cuz I loved it so much. Food was pretty good and bartenders were awesome. Came on a tuesday.Trivia night and definitely gonna come during trivia night next time we're in town. Such a great vibe and awesome down to earth people. Love tempe and love boulders on broadway!

Great spot to chill.  This bar has really good bar food options. From meat lovers to vegetarian.  Happy hour from 3-7pm (if I remember correctly)  They have tables inside and an outside patio.  Beer selection is really good. They got delicious IPA selection. (Don't be shy, ask servers for recommendations)  Place in general has almost daily events such as sports watching or even trivia night. Fun fun!   Great place to chill for few hours and forget about the scorching heat that our lively city has.

LARGE beer selection and a delicious, eclectic menu.  Staff is friendly and knows the menu as well as the tap selection.  One of my favorite spots in the valley.  Great standing daily specials.  Great for breakfast, lunch, or dinner, although if you're going for lunch on a weekday, chances are you won't be able to sample any of the beers :(

I've been here a few times now for tempe chamber events. They have some yummy sandwiches for lunch, got to try a couple chicken ones and a roast beef. They have an extensive selection of local beers! The upstairs area is good for small groups but a gets a little warm in the summer. downstairs is nice though with plenty of tv's.

Good lunch place, friendly staff.  Our group tried a few different things - burgers, club sandwich, pizza, and all had good experiences.  It's not amazing, but it's certainly reliable, and has plenty of choices, so it's good for a large group.

Food here is good. Variety of selections, but word to the wise, don't get the salad. I don't think it's very fresh.  Pizzas are where it's at here, and sometimes this place has a Groupon offering online.  Beers are to be expected. Go!

Pleasantly surprised. I had the salmon blt and my husband had the gigantic nachos delivered. Delivery was prompt but most importantly the food was good. The salmon blt had a yummy creamy spicy pesto and the nachos were so light and crispy! We also had the apple cobbler delivered but haven't tried it yet. However it looks yummy. Will order again.  3.5 - I did and it wasn't that great. The bbq mahi mani salad had what they called bbq sauce but was more like a too tangy catalina dressing. The salad had water in it probably from not draining the black beans correctly. Pretty tasteless and now I have a stomach ache.

Beer selection was large, but not with a large variety of beer types, I had a the tough time picking, since the beer type was not listed.   The calzone was respectable beer fair and a nice distraction as I watched sports.    Stop by if you are rolling on two wheels instead of four and  looking for the game and brewskies, not so worth while  for strictly a beer refill.    Review to be updated after trivia night with some friends.
We found this restaurant on bringfido.com. The food and the service was excellent. They brought out our dog bowl of ice. We will definitely be back again

Okay, I love this place. And it's not just because it's where I met my fiance 3 years ago lol  This place is sorcery. A melting pot of so many different concepts that you wouldn't think work together, but strangely, just do.  Boulders is awesome for people of all ages, and that's a really delicate and impossible to maintain balance you won't see elsewhere. Young people, middle aged people, some seniors, the occasional child... It may sound like a mess but it truly just works. And when you're here, youre so busy enjoying yourself you forget the people around you. What I'm saying is unless you're looking for a clubby scene, this place is for anyone and everyone, and is a great place to meet new people, make interesting conversations with strangers, and leave with new friends.  Boulders has Atmosphere with a capital A. Not quite divey, kind of like a lodge sort of feel, like something you would find up in flagstaff. It's also somewhere you can go in jeans and a t-shirt and feel fine about that, or if you wanna dress swanky chic with a full face, it just works.. They also cater alot to outdoorsy vocations like biking, climbing, etc. For example, there's a bike bar inside. Evenings and weekends are great! They have trivia night, which is always well-attended and a great time. Friday's and weekends have a nice comfortably busy volume, and weeknights still have a comfortable amount of people.  They have private "party" rooms, all kinds of different types of sections and seating, and a huge private loft great for get togethers and casual events and parties.  They do events which are super cool and fun, the bartenders and servers dress up for Halloween, tour de fat, and other occasions.  They also have tons of games behind the bar, which is a fun an whimsical touch. Things like jenga, monopoly, battleship, etc. Heck yeah, fun hahahaha Their patio is great for just hanging out with friends, talking and relaxing over some great drinks and food. It has an art Deco fire pit, bags, misters, mood lighting, and plenty of seating with umbrellas and space heaters in the winter. Patio is smoker AND dog friendly!  The drinks are great, the constantly changing beer selection is expansive, impressive, and well priced. I guarantee, Boulders has something for every taste, from the cider fanatic like me, to the beer snob. Mixed drinks are great, too! Cheap, strong, and delicious.  The food is sooooooo stinkin good. Pizzas are huge, full of toppings, and delicious. (can I recommend the Chuck Norris double deckered with the California carver?!) Oh man, and their waffle fries and bar foods? So. Good.  They also have tvs all over with various games on, and movie nights, yet somehow that doesn't detract from the "Lodge feel" sorcery!  They have a special brunch menu on weekends, with, get ready, phenomenal house recipe bloody Mary's from scratch, no cheap mix here, friend! Don't be thrown off by the dated looking brunch menu, it's looks that way for a reason: the breakfast foods are delicious and have lasted the years.  Last thing, the STAFF IS AMAAAAAAZING. When you come here more than a few times, you feel like family. They see you, know you, remember you. They will shoot the moo poo with you, and it's not unusual to make friends with them outside of Boulders, because they're just cool people. And let me ask you, how many bars do you know of with an ever changing beer list that see you walk in, and based off your past selections and knowing what you like, will have your beer waiting for you when you get to the bar? And even more, it's something you haven't tried before but LOVE? That is Boulders service. Like the aforementioned cider aficionado? That's me. I'm also a wierdo and drink anything carbonated through a straw, beer and cider included. I walk up to the bar and if they arent already filling my glass before popping in my requisite straw, it's there waiting with straw dancing in the bubbles. When I bring new people and we sit inside, I don't have to even say my order they always smile and say whatever the current cider best suited to me is. I know I've waxed eternal on anticipated orders and ciders with straws, but you just don't find that anywhere. A few months ago, I came in one night after receiving 2 extractions, 7 fillings, and, same day, got braces. Yes I'm insane. Deal with it lol moving along, I was ravenous, but in a hell of a lot of pain and couldn't eat. My server (shout out to you Addya!) brought me soup and an amazing assortment of things she thought I could eat. Things like pineapple, olives, cooled soft cooked chicken, various pizza toppings, etc. Not gonna lie, I cried. But that's just how the staff here is. They're awesome.   This place is life, and I will be a patron til this business ceases to exist.

First and last time i go into this place...  Let me say first that I have always wanted to come here just to have a sit down with friends and drinks, but it so happens my son and I walked in one day after a busy day of errands.  I did not want to cook and it was on our way home.  I was disappointed right off the bat because we sat down and I don't know what, because it was just me and my son, but no one wanted the table, (I know how it is, i used to wait tables) but we waited patiently and after about 10 minutes server came over and said he did not see us and apologized.  More than likely taking a smoke break due to he smelled like smoke.  We ordered nachos and cheese sticks, (weren't very hungy) and they were fine.  My complaint to this place would be that I went to ask if they had SunBru from Four Peaks and in Tempe you should be carrying FourPeaks anything at all times, in my opinion!  The server I asked said yes they had it and then my server came back to get my drink order. I asked and he said he would check and came back and said infact no they did not have it.  I settled for an FP 8th street Ale.  The server seemed nervous checking on us, not sure was that was about but he rarely came by, my son was never offered a refill on his drink and I was not offered another beer... seemed weird for a bar... anyway we waited about 10 minutes for the check and when we walked out after completing the transaction, no one said a word to us.  Very strange place.  I can see the neighborhood bar attraction and I wish it was different but I will not set foot in this place again.  Will stick with the ol standby, Four Peaks and never stray again!

We came in at 12:30 on a Friday. The bartender, who was our server too, was pretty knowledgeable about her beers and drinks. We ordered a roast beef au jous dip, pear quesadilla and BBQ wings. The food was mediocre. The au jous was thin, the roast beef was pretty bland. The pear quesadilla was good, didn't have the oomph we were looking for. The wings were terrible. An odd flavored BBQ sauce, they weren't crispy. We didn't have a long wait for food or drinks though! That's good. And the waffle fries are great.  Overall, I'd probably only come back for drinks.
