Boulders is my JAM!!!   Seriously though, this is our favorite neighborhood bar that happens to have amazing food. The decision to move into our current home was made purely on how close it was to long board to Boulders (longer story behind this), and we have been coming here for years now.   One of the best parts about this place is their employees. There are several amazing individuals that work here and provide a wonderful customer service experience. Being a regular has its perks.   You can never go wrong with a burger, hungover mans best friend, or one of the phenomenal quesadillas. I love that their menu is diverse and most everything is thoroughly enjoyable. They have great specials every day of the week and trivia night is always a blast.   Do yourself a favor and stop in here for an evening beer and burger or even better, a weekend breakfast and a famous Doubleday Bloody Mary.

We have been coming into boulders almost every Saturday for the past two months ! Everytime we have come in we have had the same bartender (Justin) && manager (Ben) ... Awesome service , always!!   Also a great place to come late nights for pizza && wings !!

Wanted to find a place close to my hotel that had a good selection of beer and man did they! They had a draft menu that must've had about 30 ish beers to choose from! They're known for their pizzas but I decided to take a risk and go with the chicken pesto sandwich! I was pleasantly surprised! Taste was great and the bread was a cheese covered French bread! People were raving about their waffle fries and they really are fantastic! It's also a seat yourself establishment and the bartenders were very knowledgeable about the beers and attentive!
Great beer selection, good vibe, and they carry my hometown beer Sierra Nevada. I'll be back!

Boulders on Broadway is the perfect place to catch the game. It has a lot of space and a great vibe. Not to mention a ton of beers on tap and half-off bottle deals (actually - they have a lot of deals, it's the type of place that has some sort of special every night.)  It's also the kind of place where you can get to know the staff if you stop in regularly.   The food is fairly good for a bar - still have a lot of the greasy favorites (and they are favorites for a reason) but there are also some decent salads and such.   I've never really had a bad time at Boulders and it's becoming a go-to place to hang out with a large group of people.

This place is the epitome of your neighborhood bar.  Great place to get drunk at.  I would venture to say that this was one of the highlights of this neighborhood.  I started going here long before they even had the outdoor patio.  Yeah I knew about this place before it was cool.  Suck on that, hipsters.    Their food has improved by leaps and bounds.  I can happily eat their pizza now.  The California carver is especially good.  I wouldn't say its 5 star good but its worthy of bar food.  The 5 stars is for the atmosphere.    If you ever want some sage advice on a brew, ask the resident employee Chris Shinn.  His suggestions will not disappoint.    They are packed every Tuesday for trivia.  Be wary of the cheating redditors that play upstairs.  They don't leave their parents basement that often, therefore they don't understand that looking up the answer on your cell phone is frowned upon.    All in all this is a solid place to get a brew and some food.
This place is amazing. I would, and do, recommend this place to anyone. Although they get busy at times and the servers are overwhelmed, the food is always perfect. The owner is such a nice guy!!

The food and service are both fine here, but I've experienced better. I love love love that this is so close to my house. My husband and I walk over there a lot, usually later at night to enjoy the late night happy hour. The atmosphere of the place is intriguing to me. I don't know if I love it or hate it. It is dark, and oh Lawdy those bathrooms are atrocious. Worse than any I have ever encountered, not exaggerating. I want to love this place even more since it's so close, but I'm just not feelin it yet. It is fun to go out there, but the place itself is just okay to me. I am not a big fan of beer, but my husband is constantly ordering different beers and it makes him happy so I guess I'm happy too. Except for that one time he bought an $18 bottle of beer and nobody warned him it would cost that much. That was no fun and I feel like somebody should have mentioned that it was so costly since they recommended it. For shame. But yeah, I like it here and I will continue to come back on a fairly regular basis for sure.

The half pound burger was tasty enough but did not seem like really a half pound. More like the 3rd pound. The pork sandwich was just average. The manager came over to check on us than we told her about how we thought the portions are pretty small. She was pleasant enough to talk to And apologize that we were totally satisfied. That's it.

Boulders sits in an old Old Chicago franchise with some reworking done to make it somewhat bike-oriented. It's in a weird area, on Broadway between Priest and Mill, and a little difficult to find because the sign on Broadway is fairly small. We came for the $5 sandwiches and $3 beer that were advertised on their web site for their all-day Saturday happy hour. When we finally stumbled upon the place, the entrance was fairly hard to find. It's in the back. Upon entering, you find a cavernous, two-story, multi-leveled, dimly lit restaurant with tons of big booths and various separated rooms. Kind of strange. Almost completely empty. I got a look at the menu and immediately realized that the special was actually $6 sandwiches and $3.50 beers on tap. Whatever. The draft selection is a little bit better than you'd find at an Old Chicago location, with some Dogfish Heads, a Rogue and a Ska. They also had a Deschutes red on tap, which I had never had, that wasn't on the menu because it was so new. A lot of the beers are not available for the happy hour prices, such as the aforementioned Dogfish Heads and Ska. So I opted for the Rogue Dead Guy Ale and started looking at the menu. They have quite a bottles selection too, leaving off a lot of the American crap (Bud, Coors, etc.), which I really admire in places, and sticking to the more well-known micros, with a few Four Peaks and that Papago orange stuff to round out the locals. They even had a couple of Nimbuses (Tucson). The bottles were not on special, but I prefer draft beer anyway. The sandwiches and burgers list was a bit more than I had expected. Chicken, turkey, a sirloin (not available as the $6 special) and a couple of veggie options. For sides, they had salads, fries (waffle) and their new, housemade potato chips. I had the southwest turkey with the chips. Those chips are basically thick pieces of potato, lightly fried with a bit of seasoning. They were very good, and I was glad that I got them. The sandwich was nice: deli turkey, cheese and a bit of chipotle sauce for a little kick. My girlfriend got the burger, and I was a bit jealous. It was a rectangular patty on what looked like a ciabatta bun. She said it was one of the best burgers she had in a while and actually finished the thing off, which is really rare for her. Service was good. I felt bad that there were so few people in there, but the guy was really, really nice and attentive. Two beers and the sandwich ended up $13 just for me, which is a pretty good deal when you think about it. Downside is that it's a little dingy inside. They should probably work a bit on cleaning the place up. Maybe get some sort of interior design consultant to come in and revamp the place a bit. Also, the location is just so weird. I've stayed at that Motel 6 across the street years ago, and I never thought I'd opt to spend any additional time in that neighborhood. But I would definitely go back, and would recommend it to those who like their beer. Maybe a good alternative to Four Peaks since they're perpetually packed, although some people may be scared off by the atmosphere here. Give it a chance!

Boulders has been my go-to neighborhood bar for a while (BEER LIST), but really exceeded my expectations this week, and merited a review.   I recently coordinated a professional development event for the graduate students in my department. We wanted a place with good beer and food, but also that had a private room that was quiet enough that we could talk. This doesn't seem like a tall order, but Boulders was the only place we knew that had a private, quiet room. I've seen a chess club meet in there a few times.  We had a large party of 15, and we were seated in the "lounge," a room off the main dining area with a booth, a large table, and a door! The room was perfect, and everyone was able to hear the professor that came to speak to us. Our server Jake took excellent care of our group, and was really respectful and deft at delivering orders, refilling waters, and getting additional rounds of beer without interrupting our speaker. He even closed the door quietly as he came and went. I felt like the staff really went above and beyond to accommodate us, and the meeting went off without a hitch thanks to their help.  Thank you, Boulders! I don't think we'll ever meet on campus again. :)

Got the fish and chips and left with no regrets. I was sick as a dog so I couldn't really enjoy the atmosphere or food but my family LOVES this place so I trust them.   The place is huge inside with tons of seating and parking is easy. Bathrooms were a little mehhhh but I ain't mad.   4 Stars Boulders. Ya killin' it!!!

The beer list here is GREAT. Seriously. If you like craft brews, go here.  The food is meh. There are a lot of really interesting combinations, but the execution wasnt the best. The service is also meh. All 8 of us had to be wary when our waitress came around to tell her that so and so needed something too. She would take one or two orders at a time.   Seriously though, the beer is awesome.

I don't have much bad to say about Boulder's but since there isn't an ability to give a fractional star this place gets 5.  Honestly the beer selection on it's own would be enough to get 5 stars for me.  Between the rotating draft beer selection and the bottle/can list there's pretty much something for every taste.  The bar staff is knowledgeable when it comes to what they have, especially Justin, Dave, and Alex, so if you want a recommendation they won't point you in the wrong direction.  The bar is fairly laid back most of the time but can get rowdy during ASU games.  It's more of a neighborhood bar than a sports bar so there aren't a ton of tv's, but they do open early on the weekends (9 or 10am) so people do come in for early morning soccer some times.  They run different specials pretty much every day of the week.  I've never been disappointed with anything I've ordered from their food menu.  Usually I'll go with a burger and while they are all good, for my preference I usually go for the Asian Bob with a Ceasar Salad instead of the waffle fries.  The Bombay Street Dog was at one point a summer only item which has found a permant place on the menu after appearing in Phoenix New Times article "Our 10 Favorite Spicy Dishes in Metro Phoenix" last year.  If you are there for breakfast, everything I've had is good.  My recommendation would be the Chuck Norris Scramble and a Bloody Mary (it has bacon in it).

This was my first time after being around 3 years. I had a restriction to this place as it gets crowded with college students.   Good for beers from micro-breweries specially when they are 1/2 off!! Still the can and bottle won't beet the draft.   Food? we only had the frigging nachos, that are gooooood for their crispiness. More I wouldn't dare.

Your typical bar/grill menu. Really nothing to go to for food, just compliments your beer you're ordering. The dining areas along the bar are rather dirty, or at least were when I was there, especially the menus themselves. They stuck to one another and we're stained. If they can't clean something as simple as menus, makes me worry what the kitchen looks like.

My local bar, Boulders is a four minute walk from my house and I love it. They have a very large and always changing beer selection and a great crowd every night to hang out with. This is not a college bar, you could run into anyone here, young or old. The food is good, but it is bar food, this is not a gourmet spot, but I love their big freaking nachos and fish n chips. My only particular gripe is the jukebox... the music is either really good or it makes you want to leave... but with the best happy hours in town and friendly atmosphere, it's a very minor complaint. I am here at least every Thursday night with some pals and I don't see that changing any time soon.

My husband and I love this place! The food is always amazing, and they have a great selection of beer! Today we had the pleasure of being served by Kristin at the bar top. It was seriously the best service we have had in a very long time including any other restaurant that we frequent! She was friendly, fast, and made the experience the best we've had at this establishment! Thank you Kristin!

Great atmosphere. I had a dinner salad that acted like a side salad. Not enough of any of the ingredients to make it worthy of a dinner salad. The grape vinaigrette was the perfect mix of sweet and vinegar.

A couple of the managers, Rob and Ben, helped me pull off a very random request.  I first spoke with them on the phone and they were both more than willing to help.  I came it and dropped off some items to Rob and again, without any explanation needed on my end, said he would take care of it.  Sure enough everything was setup the way I asked and they let the servers know as well, so I didn't get any confused looks.  I can't thank you enough for such amazing service and BONUS, the food was absolutely delicious!  I had the pesto quesadilla and my booth mate had a mouthwatering hamburger with waffle cut fries...mmmmmm!  I lacked in getting the servers name, but she was very attentive and wonderful!  Thank you Boulders On Broadway for amazing service!  I cannot wait to come back!!!

Ok, I come to PHX once or twice a year on business.  I LOVE THIS BAR. Pizza (kaiser) burgers (moose drool), and just super nice people. As for the beer, I have found my two new favorites. "I drink Ambers" 90 Shillings and FW DBA.. Stay Classy Phoenix!
Try the Chuck Norris Pizza.  Full of Meat and get it with the Thin Crust.  It holds up with all the meat toppings.

Okay, this was recommended by a friend who had their holiday party catered upstairs. I was not expecting BEST WINGS EVER!!!!! It is a hipster place with TONS of seating and great burgers and wings. This is what I know of it so far. They have private room for parties, LOTS of craft brews of every sort.  Bike and car parking (unlike Four Peaks).   This is not "upscale" it is very relaxed, calming and the food is the same, nothing hugely complicated but lots to choose from. Wings are standard buffalo, (see pic), we ordered some of differing heat and none were beyond medium for my taste. I like them hotter but the meat was cooked properly and they were crispy.   You can also sit outside with the out of control misters.  It's good for your lungs, like a humidifier in the outdoors. I will highly recommend this place for happy hour, which is every hour.

I've been here a few times, and it is a great dive bar. We have tried going on our lunch break, because our work is right down the street. Everytime we are late, but the food is pretty decent bar food! They have an awesome beer selection, and last time I went I had a great belgium! This is a cool little hipster bar that I am definitely returning to:)

I've come here a few times and the more I go, the more of a fan I become. They have an awesome beer selection (not that they have a bunch of taps, but the ones they have are awesome!). If you enjoy craft beer, they have something for you. Me and my girlfriend like to come here for happy hour and get an assortment of pizza-related apps and stick around for Trivia Night! This place is surprisingly big so it's great for lunch, happy hour, dinner or big group get-togethers. I'm definitely a fan! :D

YES!!! and YES and YES!! too bad i don't live closer. I really love this place.  They get a huge four stars off the bat because they are supporters of Pedal Craft. I love that!!  Boulders has a great tap selection that fluctuates often. The food is good. Not great, but the atmosphere easily makes up for it.   It is a dive that you could go to every day and even take a casual date to without feeling like you're slumming it.   Dive bars = win  Bars that love cycling = 5 star win.  I prefer this to the big brewery places closer to that community college down the road...  BEAR DOWN!!

I have been going to Boulders on Broadway every Thursday night with a group of friends since August. I love it. The atmosphere is really laid-back and on Thursdays many of their bottled beers are half-off. I have only eaten there a few times but each time the food was delicious. I highly recommend the steak and walnut salad as well as their home-made potato chips. Boulders is the perfect place to go if you are looking for some place low-key.
Good pub style food with a selection of pizzas, burgers, sandwiches & appetizers. Best part for me was the excellent beer selection.

We ate here while visiting from out of town, and were very pleased. The pizza was good, salad was very good, beer selection was great, and the service was outstanding. Delicious chocolate chip cookies sundae for desert too.

Trivia night on Sunday and Tuesday is lots of fun Their draft beer changes all the time which is nice but I wish the beer list had the beer type and alcohol percentage included It'd make choosing a lot easier . Definitely try the Traveler Illusive draft if they have it in though

Stopped in here after helping a mate move house who lives just down the street. Came down for lunch and actually ended coming back the same evening. Nice bar, friendly staff and good location. This bar has a nice selection of beers on tap and the food (bar) is good. I had a salad and it was fresh and the dressing tasty. I think I found a new place to hit when I'm visiting my friends and its walking distance which makes it even better!

I was visiting Tempe for the first time on business, and jumped at the chance of my work colleague, Vince, going out to lunch (just so that I could try the local hangouts); we kind of looked at him funny when he non-chalantly said something 'bout "boulders" ...  ...and it's no wonder that not all of us knew what he was talkin' bout, cuz it's pretty discreet-looking, and located in a building that came right out of the 80's. You wouldn't know right off-the-bat if this was a restaurant/bar, and with the interesting name and all, that makes it all the more intriguing.  Being a cyclist myself, I knew it was a good sign when I noticed the interior bike parking! It looks like a pretty cool, laid-back, and non-pretentious atmosphere with younger-gen worker bees and clientele mixed with wood-trim decor, a bar, and TVs in the background.  It wasn't at all deserted, and though not necessarily packed, was fairly full with people, and looked to be a well-known neighborhood hangout, and I thought that this was a good sign.   The menu was fairly descriptive, and made me want to order everything on the menu. It consists of your typical bar-food, but all changed-up with their own special twist.  They had something called the "Big Freakin' Nacho" (lightly fried chips topped with mozarella, sausage, olives, and peppers) and upon advice from my colleague, went with the half order (at $7.49) since I heard that they mean business when they say, "big." I ordered this with EXTRA cheese.  I also went with the Costa Rican Cesar. My colleagues ordered other items such as the wings, pizza nuggets, the burger, etc.  The service -   Our waitress was pleasant, took our drink and food order, and all-in-all, the service was relatively quick considering the decent size of our party of 8. She was pretty attentive the whole entire time!  On to the food -   The salad was fairly good, and was a good portion. People can screw up salad, yet what I got was what I'd expect from a place of this genre.  I ordered my nachos with extra cheese, yet they were pretty far from cheesy. In fact, I kind of think that it's the cheese that is the GLUE that holds it together in nachos, so with every bite, I either had nothing but "chip", or I had stuff rolling off of it.   Note that I didn NOT complain or send it back because even for a "half" portion, it still came out on a pizza tray full of chips, and I pretty much felt like (if I complained), all they were gonna do was just add the cheese and heat up the platter of chips again, which would've made them stale...  Other than this one thing though, the taste formula is pretty right-on, the chips tasted like they were fried in-house, and as the menu described, they tasted light. They could've been so much better though with that extra cheese it needed.  I tried the Pizza Nuggets, and they were good - tasted like pizza sauce and cheese slathered on soft bread. The wings were just so-so (good, but not quite good enough to give me that wow factor).  If I could I'd give this place 3.5 stars; they'd be a 4-star if they somehow stepped up the quality just a tad-bit -   ...they seem to have the right formula going, and their food is unique enough; good enough taste-wise, and large enough portion-wise, yet, in my humble opinion, they need to step it up to make that difference between the thought of "food just being thrown together" vs. really going for that wow factor.  ...I'd most-definitely come here agian, though.

This place is great for the beer lovers.  They have tons of beer on tap and even more bottled ones.  They have the small brewery offerings that are missing at so many places.    I am judging it almost entirely on the beer alone.  We ordered some nachos which were some odd twist on nachos.  I was unaware something as classic as nachos needed fixing.  I'll stick with the classic.  It seems a lot of bicycle riders patronize this joint which I guess is cool... if you ride a bike.  The building is unique and quite large.  There was a guy playing music when we were there.  I went several months ago and might go again, but I think I would prefer to keep trying new places in search of a gem.

This place is awesome! Unique decorations, great atmosphere, great beer, and good service. Our server was really sweet and helpful. She seems to really enjoy her job!   The beer is really good and so are the wings and pizza!  I would advise against the margaritas unless you really like them sweet! I liked mine, but I love sweet drinks.  Definitely a good place to come with a group of friends.

My girl and I come here around once a week on average. Always a great beer selection. The chicken bruschetta is supremely delicious. Everything I've had here has been great. Also and as important is the staff who is the best. Isaac is usually my server and he makes it interesting and awesome everytime.
My husband loves micro brews but I'm not a beer drinker. At Boulders hr gets great beer, and I enjoy the food and wine. Their mahi salad is so awesome!

One of the social groups I belong to has a group that goes to Boulders on Broadway on Sundays for trivia night. I have been a couple of times, but this place just bores me. The beer list is long, but there isn't anything on it that rocks my boat. The food looks and tastes like decent bar food, but just not exciting. The service tends to be slow, but in my experience trivia nights can be overwhelming, so I don't hold that against them. It is just a very blah place.

We stopped by after a show at ASU.  My cousin was wondering about this place when we drove up. When we entered the place was packed with people playing "Trivia Night". We were greeted by Mary, who served us all evening. She is very nice and is a hard worker. Between taking care of us, she was busy cleaning all the tables after Trivia Night.  We are a party of seven and all ordered something different from the menu.   We ALL like the food, especially my niece was was skeptical about the place to begin with.  Overall a pleasant evening and experience.

We arrived a few hours before trivia started. We had a party of 7. The staff INSISTED we sit in a big trivia room, saying "oh we don't have any parties tonight, you're fine." Right before trivia started the manager comes up and passive aggressively starts saying "oh we usually use this room for trivia, moving forward you guys really shouldn't be in this room..."   A while later we invited a group of people into our room for trivia because they needed seating. We weren't planning on playing trivia. And the other group got yelled at because there were more than 12 people in be room...even though we weren't playing trivia!   We also ordered nachos that came out wrong...they comped us and brought out a second order of nachos...those were burnt to hell. As if this wasn't bad enough, the entire time we were there (paying customers, eating and having drinks) multiple servers kept coming by asking if we were done, as if to hurry us out the door!   This was the first and last time I will EVER go there. What a terrible experience. I would not recommend going there. The ONLY good part of this experience was our server (the receipt said his name was Delicious???). Whatever his name is, he was so sweet and attentive. Everyone else sucked.

Place is cool, super casual but clean and food is pretty decent.  Service is always good and I like the atmosphere.  Usually end up here for a lunch meeting and it seems to always go well so how can I complain.  I have had the fish tacos, calzone, and burger so far.  Looks like we are going to meet here once per month so I will have to keep you posted on any gems I find on top of everything else.  Peace
Awesome bar and grill! The beer app, while not always working, is a great touch. Everything I have ordered has always been excellent especially the unique hot dog dishes and the quesadilla.

Stopped in for happy hour a few weeks ago with a friend. I am not a huge beer fan, but they have an awesome selection. Their wine selection isn't that great...but I already figured that going in. We decided to order a few things off the happy hour menu and share a sandwich. We tried the crispy artichokes and beer queso. Both were excellent. We shared the honey chicken sandwich and waffle fries, which was delicious as well.   Overall, everything was great and will definitely return next time I am in Tempe!

Awesome beer selection. Great pizza. The server Austin is delicious. They have trivia often. A great happy hour selection. Sweet potato tots are fire. You can join their club and get neat deals through out the week. Super litty fire, fam.

TERRIBLE EXPERIENCE! Only pay cash here or don't open a tab!!!   The bartender charged another persons tab on my card and then gave them my card. After he told me what happened, he proceeded to ask me if I had cash to pay my tab! The guy that the bartender gave my card to then proceeded to spend a ton of money at Circle K. Huge inconvenience!

This is one of those places I can see why people really like it, but I just didn't really like it (it was A-OK, though).   I really do like the place itself. The rock-climbing/bicycle theme is cool. There's two stories of seating with a large wrap around bar and a large patio (that's dog friendly, I believe). There's a very unpretentious vibe. I don't come to this area often, but it seems very post-ASU (and beyond), and that seems to be reflected in the crowd that comes here.   Here's the thing though...food, service, and beer selection (although this is debatable depending on what you like) isn't all that great. Admittedly, I'm basing this on one visit. Service was particularly questionable. Me & a friend were sitting at a table right by the bar and basically it seemed to be server by committee. A couple of bartenders would occasionally check on us &  I think a waitress who was actually working the floor came by twice. They were all friendly though (just not very attentive).  As for food, we ordered two HH items and I think that may have been the issue. There's like 7-8 items that are $3.99. That's a really good deal, but the portions are pretty small & you get what you pay for. We ordered the nachos and afterwards I heard a waitress tell the table next to us they were better off ordering the "regular" nachos instead of the HH ones if they were hungry. I wish I had heard this beforehand. The nachos tasted fine, but the HH portion comes in large soup bowl. Minutes later the table next to us got a ginormous, beautiful looking platter. I would have happily paid the $4-5 extra dollars for that and would have been set, instead of ordering another okay-ish HH item (tater tots in our case).   I'm not really beer expert (by any means), but I didn't think the selection here was that great (I say this because that seems to be a huge emphasis for this place). They didn't seem to have many beers you wouldn't normally find at a place that has a large tap selection.  I'd come back here if someone suggested it, but I wouldn't be the one doing the suggesting.

The Boulders is finding its niche and for the bicycle, i'm getting my drink on crowd, they are fitting in well. However, the food has well, fallen in my estimation. Average bar food is what is being served. Gone are the plans for a beer dinner with pairings and quality dining. It has been replaced with quick foods of pizzas, strombolis and nachos. Not particularly sparkling but gets the job done when your main attraction is beer and Boulders does do beer well.  The staff has slipped into an easy, we serve those we know best and well, the rest of you, not so much. The bar has an easy 20 something feel, and its' patronage reflects it.
Not really feeling the clientele. People at the bar are quiet and cool but others in the restaurant are dipshits. I also didn't feel much from the server.

Boulders is one of my regular spots in Phoenix. I love the beer list.  There is always a good variety on the tap.  There is an app you can download to check out the selection.   They also have a full bar. The food is typical bar food.  Sandwiches, pizza, calzones, salads, burgers.  It's a-ight.  I usually just stick with their appetizers.  They overdress the hell out of their salads to the point that it's soupy.   The service is generally good in the bar area; but that's what happens when you become a barfly I guess...they're nice to the regulars.  They have a largish outdoor seating area where you can smoke.   They have a great happy hour.  There is always an eclectic group of customers.  I've met some good peeps here. The  jukebox is pretty stupendous.   Televisions show the sports.   They are really into biking and have some bike nights.   They have a very popular trivia night.

I wanted to love this place, really I did. They have amazing happy hour specials every day of the week, trivia, cool atmosphere, all the makings of a really, great bar. Unfortunately, it just.....wasn't.   All the hipsters gather to enjoy their beer that's on tap but "oh sorry, we're out of that." The employees have no idea what the specials are and it's not clearly listed anywhere so it's a guessing game.   Our waitress forgot items, which I understand, but did not come by for several minutes to check if everything had arrived correctly.   However, I did enjoy my burger which was lacking the toppings I ordered. I'm not passive aggressive or anything.   My momma always said if you don't have anything nice to say, don't say anything. So......

I have mixed feelings about this place. I'd been here years ago when it was Old Chicago, and a few times after it had changed to Boulders. I always had a good time due to the company, but it's just your average hang out restaurant. I came here for trivia night on Sat and the host at the door kindly informed us that we could seat ourselves at the bar or be seated somewhere in the GIANT restaurant. There are so many nooks it's crazy. We decided to sit at the bar and quickly found a table. It was busy, lots of people there for late dinners and trivia as we found out. Our server was nice and we indulged mostly in beers, and ended the night with two HH apps as we were starting to get hungry. A funny exchange I had while wanting to order food:  Me to bus boy: Hi! What's the difference between the mexican nachos and boulder nachos? (we didn't have a dinner menu) Bus boy: The chips (walks away)  Me and my bf just had to laugh. Later when our server came by we found out that there is a lot more different than just the chips.   I can't speak to the quality of their entrees, as we only had mozz sticks and mexican nachos, but we'll be back for trivia and beer.

Made the mistake of trying this establishment with friends  during trivia night.  The place was packed and service although friendly was hard to get.  The half off appetizers were great but the wings I got were just so-so. The selection of craft beers was latger than Iwas expecting.  Since I am new to the region I was unfamiliar with most of them. Unfortunately it was a work night so I couldn't really experiment. The brombere I had was worth a try if you like sour beers.   I would be willing to come back with friends to hang out and grab a beer if we're in the area.  Most likely wouldn't go out of my way to swing by though.

I ordered the Nachos which is just a huge try of fried wantons with cheese, pepperoni and some type of meat. That tasted interesting but it was a huge tray for $10.00.  My friends ordered a Sausage Pizza which had hot dog meat for sausage. The Chicken Alfredo tasted like the hot dogs which some weird cream.   For my waffle fries I was given cocktail sauce instead of ketchup... wtf.  i'm never going here again.

Pretty solid place that a lot of people frequent. It has a cool vibe to it and it caters to the biking community. There's a bike co-op across the street and even indoor bike racks. I came here with a group for Trivia Night and had a fun time playing with them while enjoying Happy Hour beers and sharing appetizers. I'm a huge fan of stouts, so I was glad to see more than just 1 or 2 stouts on tap; I opted for the Boulders Chocolate Shake stout and was very pleased!   We got a plate of nachos, french fries, jalapeno poppers, and something called Italian Nachos. Essentially, they were pita-like chips served with pizza toppings and red sauce. They were interesting and tasted good, but I can't say that I would get them again. To each their own!   Overall, it was a nice and laid-back environment for catching up with friends.
Happy hour apps just went up to $3.99 from $2.99.   Bad and few TVs. Not high def.   No beer descriptions.   Out of Dale's Deviant Ale cans. Out of spicy pickles appetizer!
Great place to hang out and watch Sunday Football.  Good food selection and excellent service.
Got the bfn and wasn't too impressed, not much meat, I guess I was expecting more. I'm willing to try it again when in town.
I love this place!!!! This is my neighborhood bar! Great beer,  yoummy food, fun atmosphere, awesome staff and trivia! I love it, so much fun!!!!!

Boulders can be an up and down one for me. Currently the staff has been better then they were in the past, this place does have a niche crowd, and a lot of their regulars know each other and converse and it can be cool at times and other times the regulars can make people feel very unwanted . they make the place their own which is cool but it can be a bit daunting and un welcoming for people who havent been here before . the beer choices are always on point . the food is hit and miss the pizza is decent . the wings are not suggested . over priced small and dry. The sandwiches are okay their other apps are all pretty decent .

Ummmm, I like what they've done with the place!  I still remember this as an Old Chicago, and I think this is better.  Great beer list!  Friendly and helpful staff!  But.......  The bathrooms were not well maintained and stinky (like you could smell them as you approach) and the menu appeared rather uninspired yet pricey.  This place needs to decide whether it's more dive bar or gastro pub, and then maybe I'll jump fully on board.
good hamburgers and good hefeveisen. i love the downstairs private room for our sport group meetings and the waitress comes in alot and brings beer. 2 thumbs up on that and a double like!
Good food, nice staff huge beer selection. Pizza is not hitting any home runs, but the place is great for hanging out and having drinks, apps are delicious.
My favorite neighborhood bar. Super chill atmosphere, 30 beers on tap, and appetizers are awesome! Dogs are also welcome on their outdoor patio!
I love coming here for my lunch break they get my food out quickly and the staff is very friendly!!#
Always Sunny on TV several delicious beers on tap and they have a pizza called "The Chuck Norris" and its all the animal toppings!

Went to lunch there today for my first time because I had too me up for business. This place was awesome! Great staff, great food and great environment! Had the Bacon wrapped shrimp pasta and it was Amazing! I will be back again and next time will be for drinks! Highly recommend!

Recap: the food was pretty decent, they have a good craft beer list, but unfortunately the service was awful.  Let me get this out of the way at the beginning regarding the service. The waiter was very friendly and knowledgable about both the menu and craft beer selection. I wish I got his name because he deserves credit for how hard he was busting his ass. Unfortunately he was the only waiter in the dining room area and no single man could handle that many tables and the device definitely suffered. I put this in the management for not having proper coverage.   We picked this place based on yelp reviews and the "all day happy hour".  All day happy hour on a Saturday afternoon? Sold.   The atmosphere is pretty good for a bar and grill. They have the typical beer memorabilia hanging from the walls. It was seat yourself when we arrived and we chose to sit in the dining room. The bar area looked pretty large and had several high table tops to sit at.   The waiter provided us the beer list and we were happy to see so many different craft beers. We all ordered to our likings. Unfortunately the service was slow and the beers were empty and sat empty on our tables prior to getting refilled. I would have drank a few more but time didn't allow.   The food was typical American bar and grill grub. I had a calzone that was surprisingly good. The marinara sauce here is something special. Highly recommend the sauce. I ordered a pepperoni gravy to go with it and it just seemed a weird combination mixed with calzone.   The wings were delish. We had basic buffalo sauce and a firehouse wings. They were well cooked and sauced properly. Appetizers were jalape単o tots and spicy fried pickles. The tots had a pleasant kick of spice but not too much to be unenjoyable. I hate pickles but was told they were mediocre and lacked spice for spicy pickles.   Overall the food was good and the beers were good. I would like to go back again when they have proper staffing levels and would expect my rating to jump up another star ranking.

Half off of pizzas on Monday. They also have an app that tells you what beers they currently have on draught. Justin is an excellent bartender who can recommend a beer...or two.  They also have an excellent salmon burger.

Came here for lunch on Sunday and the food was really good. Everyone at my table enjoyed their food. The service was amazing. They recommended 12 west for the beer and I think I found my new favorite beer.   They offer happy hour all day Sunday.   We will definitely be back!!!!

I went here for the first time yesterday and I was so happy with the entire experience. Our waitress was so awesome and attentive, we had a manger check on us during our meal, and the food was so awesome! I am bummed that I have lived so close to it for the past few years and have never tried it before! We found out Mondays are 1/2 price pizza so that was a great surprise. Definitely will be returning soon!

I like this place but as stated by some previous Yelpers, the service staff is a bit... special.  The last time we were in, our server smelled of Patchouli Oil and cigarette smoke.  Not appetizing at all.  We usually get the pizza nacho things but I am dying to try the Elvis pizza one of these times.  They always have a great selection of beer on tap - a little something for everyone.

It's just your average pub, albeit with an above average beer selection.   The interior is cozy and warm. There are some sports on, but with no sound. There's plenty of seating, and it's great for large groups. The waitstaff are nice, and the kitchen is quick.   The waffle fries are *amazing* but the fried fish, pizza, and probably other items are just OK. I would never, ever go out of my way to come here for anything but pints with my friends. But if you're dragged in, it's not the end of the world.

If it would be possible to give this place a half a star or less I probably would. Met a friend for drinks on a Thursday night at 8 o'clock, took half an hour for them to come get our order. Took another 20 minutes to get my drink which was supposed to be a strawberry margarita. I cannot be for sure if there was even alcohol in it they don't own a blender so it wasn't blended and it tasted bitter as if it was old alcohol. In the two and a half hours my friend and I SAT there chatting the guy came back only once to ask my friend if he wanted another beer. Then it took almost an hour for us to get the check so we could leave. Definitely not a place I will be going back to. I kinda feel sorry for my friend who is in town on business who definitely didn't get to enjoy himself.   The table was sticky upon sitting down, the place is very dated. It is most definitely not wheelchair friendly as there  are steps everywhere and I didn't see a wheelchair ramp anywhere. I ordered the cookie with ice cream on top it was so over cooked it was crispy and not very fresh.  The only good thing was that they took my margarita off the bill since the waiter saw that I had barely drank any of it.

I usually come here for trivia. The food is actually really good. Typical bar food, but it tastes great. Prices are reasonable. Gluten-free options for the man.   Beer selection used to be better. Substantially less cider than they had a year ago.   Staff is always friendly.   Hipster crowd, but they found it before it was cool so let them stay.

For St. Patty's Day my friends and I were looking for a place that had a decent bar, a few TV's, good food and maybe a pool table/ or a dartboard. We were in Tempe on vacation so we're looking around. Looking on Yelp we settled on Boulders On Broadway. It ended up being a real good choice. Plenty of parking and easy to find. As soon as we walked in we were greeted with a smile and warm welcome. It's a simple gesture but other places seem to forget to do it. Good nachos and deep dish pizza. We spent a good four hours drinking and eating, watching NCAA tournament basketball and playing darts. No pool table here but fun was had by all.  Even played some songs on the jukebox. The jukebox was hooked up to the TouchTones phone app. So we could pick songs from our phone without getting up. You just pay for credits and pick songs on your phone. It was easy. Overall, a great bar to relax with friends. Not too rowdy and lots of booths for some privacy if needed. Great customer service. The crew working there are very patron friendly. Support local business especially the good ones. In Tempe is Boulders On Broadway. A gem of a bar/ pizza joint. Eat and drink here.

This place is phenomenal. They have a huge selection of beers on tap and in bottles I have never seen so much in one place. The odd thing is I have never heard about this place till I started working down in Tempe, but once I tried it I will drive across town on the weekends even when I am not working to go here. I suggest trying the Pizza and the Pizza Nachos, they are my absolute favorites. This place gets PACKED in the evenings and on weekends but it is a casual environment and is highly recommended.

I have been here a number of times, going back to when it was a Old Chicago's.  On our latest trip I couldn't help but notice a really foul musty moldy aroma that really turned me off.  The food was good as was the beer, just got the feeling that the clenliness may be going downhill.

I visited this place twice for trivia night, which was fun and it's during happy hour so prices for appetizers, like wings and fried pickles were cheap. Get the jalape単o poppers. The staff is attentive too. You do have to download their app to view their beer menu. I assume that it rotates frequently, however, on both nights, when I selected a drink, the server would say they just ran out. If they're going to be that technologically advanced, then maybe the menu should be real time. Haha.  The food is good, the beer is good, trivia was fun, the staff was friendly. What more can you ask for? I'm sure I'll be back!

I picked this place out to meet up with a friend because it was somewhere half way between where both of us lived and it wasn't right in the heart of ASU so we didn't have to deal with the traffic near and around ASU.. this place was pretty decent, good music and a nice selection of beers on draft and bottles/cans.. we shared a big plate of nachos which consisted of cheese,pepperoni,sausage, banana peppers and Olives.. and small marinara sauce..  the only thing I'm taking a star out of the ratings is because they got our bills mixed up.. so our bill was more then it should have been.. which was no biggie but I don't get how you can get a bill mixed up with a different table.. but other then that everything was good

I would've never stepped foot into this place if I were to judge it by its exterior alone. It looks like it could serve as the location shot for a post-apocalyptic prison planet sci-fi film. Just a big ol' concrete box sitting on a patch of asphalt, with no indication of life inside. But maybe I'm being a bit hyperbolic.  Upon entering I was greeted with all the coziness of a comfortable college beer bar. You can tell they take beer here seriously from all of the bric-a-brac on the walls and the selection of tap handles. My inaugural visit to this fine watering hole was incited by a meetup with fellow beer lovers, the occasion being a beer tasting and learn-in conducted by a visiting beer scholar from Odell Brewing Company. I was late so I didn't join in the beer class, so I plunked down my happy ass with my fellow beer fans, and resolved to do my studying by osmosis. I ordered a delicious Odell Myrcenary Double IPA which satisfied my inner beer baby.  All this quaffing, and joking, and jostling, and elbowing of the ribs (and things of this nature) made me hungry for the local fare. I decided I would sample the wings here. I was not disappointed! The wings they served me were more of a dry variety. This makes for a very crispy wing, which is KEY, so they definitely get points for that. As for the Jamaican Jerk wings, there was no sauce, but a generous dusting of spices that were both elusive and delicious (I'm almost certain I detected ginger and allspice). I also ordered their Smokin' Jalapeno Firehouse wings... which I thought at first would be too spicy. The cornerstone of this slightly wetter spice treatment is a rub made of red jalape単o peppers. Despite my fear, I dove in, ignoring the flames of Hell engulfing me, and got down-and-dirty with those tasty winglets. These wings are good!! And since they're drier than most, they are perfectly suited for generous dipping in ranch or blue cheese. There's also something suspiciously crack-like about the blue cheese dressing here... it is otherworldly!  This place is the perfect escape from the drudgery of the wage slave work week.  Throw off the shackles, ignore both moons that are glowing purple, and hunker down here with your fellow inmates for some great beer and some amazing wings.

Staff was helpful, friendly & attentive which is awesome for a seat yourself establishment. Loved the different sections of seating; we were a large party of 8 with 2 small children & were able to be in a separate room with a large table. It was nice to have the space to ourselves but still feel the ambiance of the restaurant. Every thing was great that we ordered (shrimp tacos, mahi-mahi tacos, kid's make your own pizzas, jerk chicken wings, big freaking nachos, waffle fries & cheesy beef sandwich). I had the cheesy beef sandwich & it was very yummy. The star for me was the bread, it was fresh & tasted baked in house. The aus jus was also very good. Bathrooms were clean with an interesting setup but not giving it way. If we didn't live in Kansas this would became a regular haunt for us.

I love coming here for two things: big freaking nachos and beer. I've tried multiple entrees here and really nothing has been good. These include their calzones, pastas, salads, strombolis...ok their moose drool burger is A-OK I'll give them that, but most everything else-- I was left with disappointment. Well, back to the big freakin nachos.. these are the greatest thing invented. Seriously hard to explain, its got chips (that are more like a fried wonton/pizza crust) and all the best pizza toppings like cheese, pepperoni, sausage (and more) with a side of marinara. I swear this order is HUGE (probably on a Large pizza dish) and could potentially feed a large group but I could probably eat the whole thing by myself due to its tastiness. Its always crowded and parking can be a problem on trivia nights but its a cool place for some brews and big freakin nachos.
I love the pizza at this place and the giant salads with blue cheese dressing. This really is one of my favorite lunch spots to go with my co-workers. They are friendly and the service fast.

We come here all the time for Team Trivia.  It's a great atmosphere for that, as there are often over 30 teams competing.  The food isn't bad - it's pretty typical for bar food, for the most part.  Nothing really stands out to me though, that I'd recommend.  The best part about this place is definitely their beer selection.  They've got a ton of bottles and beers on draft and are always rotating seasonal selections in.

Beer selection great, atmosphere like an out of place ski lodge in the desert, pool tables partial broken....not much else to say.  I guess this place is a decent place to go once to check it out, I can't say I would bother going again. I guess between the extremely bright lights, and eclectic ski lodgian decor, it just doesn't tickle my fancy.  (if I even had a fancy)   My date and I relived some moments of our past and played a challenging game of pool, similar to when we first met. We had some drinks, and played reindeer games, and chatted and joked. No doubt it was a great time. I guess atmosphere has become even more important for me lately, even if the beer selection is wide ranging and the prices are excellent. This place definitely screams " I make great pizza, I swear!" It seems like you could potential get a good pizza pie here, even if it looks as if Vale Colorado vomited inside this place.  Colorado is not known for it's pizza, so I am not sure if I can trust it.   Overall Boulders gets a 3 because of the beer selection, that aside it is a low 2 rating.

Boulders is what every low-key bar should aim to be. They have an AMAZING beer selection. The beer list changes often to reflect the season, and always includes local beers in addition to the typical staples. The happy hour deals are great (and their bar food is ACTUALLY good). But what I LOVE about Boulders is the trivia! Saturday night, the place is a madhouse, but if you get there early, it's a blast!

I don't get the hype. This place is alright. For a beer bar, the selection could be a little bit bigger. The food was par at best (we got the hot wings and nachos). For some reason the place had a weird stench when we were in there...idk if it was the bar or a customer. It's not in the best part of town either which definitely takes away from the appeal.  Overall, okay, not great.
Very good food, some great beers.  I'll toss up a 5 star as soon as they start supplying real Irish whiskey (Green Spot please ;)
Boulders on Broadway is the best establishment in all of Tempe. The sweet potato tots are heavenly and they have every beer you could ever dream of. I love you, Boulders.

The food here is excellent, considering it's a bar. Their wings are probably the best I've had.  While the servers are always pleasant, the service time is very hit or miss. I recommend sitting near the bar, to get the quickest service possible.  The seating is a little crowded here, especially on busy trivia nights. I can't be upset that the place is doing good business though.  My biggest gripe, is specifically in regards to my last visit. Without getting too specific, a drunk guy sitting behind me started shouting and swearing at me. When he saw it didn't phase me, he started with the threats. I kept my cool the whole time, thinking the staff at the bar, would take care of the guy who had too much to drink. I was wrong. They didn't kick him out, they even continued serving him alcohol. It was absolutely mind boggling to me that several bartenders witnessed the whole event, as well as all the customers in the vicinity, and yet none of them addressed the issue at all. I don't know if it's because of a lack of training on how to deal with such a situation, or if it was just a lack of caring. Either way, it left a real sour impression.

Great beer selection, friendly servers, and the food keeps getting better and better (fancy burgers, freshly made chips, sirloin tacos, yes!). Half off bottles Thursdays and half off pizzas Mondays make this place a great regular hangout. Go here when you want to hang out with friends for a chunk of evening somewhere you can actually hear each other.

Here right now, worst service ever, 30 minutes for beer!!! Big party and one waitress, poorly managed!!! Do not recommend this place, service so bad can't give critique on food because we about to leave the service is so bad!!! Do not waste your night here!!!! Never got my order, ate scraps from the rest of the party!!!! Done ever waste your time!!!!

Only visited out on the patio with my dog and some friends. Great beer selection and have a lot of food options on their menu. Asked our server to help me and a friend pick a pizza and recommended the BBQ. It was good.
Great pizza, had the bad day and amazing local beers. If in town a must visit.   Service was top notch and the environment is cool and fresh.

Great food & awesome service!  I live in Southern California, whenever I visit Phx I always make sure to get to Tempe & enjoy the California Carver Burger or the Grilled Pesto Chicken sandwich,  my favorites! The staff is courteous & friendly, good beverage selection and food that never disappoints!

Call it nostalgia or whatever you will but I have always loved Boulder's. It is the perfect college bar for students who care about how their beer tastes. Boulders really cares about their beer, and it shows. Not only are they constantly changing what's on tap (though not as unique these days, they've been doing it longer than most), but they keep track of their updated list through their own smartphone app. Its a simple app, but I thought it was a nice, extra step toward creating a positive experience.  Boulders has both good bar food and a very reasonable happy hour. If I still lived nearby this would be my ideal place to drop in for happy hour, try a few new beers, and get something to munch on. Though its been awhile since I've ordered a real meal here, I remember them being very good, especially the pizza/calzones.   This bar also doubles as a restaurant. The bar is separate enough from the restaurant seating area that I think you could reasonably take a family here without cause for concern. They also have a decent patio if you prefer to sit outside.  I highly recommend Boulder's to anyone who enjoys reasonably priced and constantly rotating craft beers.

Cool bar, bike friendly, good draught selection!  Told the bartender I drink everything and that he should pick me a good beer, the result was a great suggestion that I enjoyed thoroughly.  This building's layout is kinda odd with a loft and a couple side rooms set up with dining tables.  This results in a cool ambiance and a take-me-back-to-the-golden-years attitude.  Love it.
World of Beer may challenge the title of best taps in tempe, but Boulders is a great place.  Unique selection, good food and service.

I don't remember this place at all! I think I was completely hammered after a pub crawl bike ride from Shade Tree bike shop. It was a thing called "I suck at poker" where you smoke a bunch of weed and slam a few beers before heading out into the city on your bike. Ill-prepared to find my way or even care, we headed out on a purposeless pursuit of an untamed ornithoid. Crashing one or maybe twice, I found myself parking my two wheeled man motor in the bar and quenched my drunken mind with what I can only guess was a fine cold pint of drought IPA... Do that and buy something to eat while you're there!

Great pizza, Chicago style (but not too thick). Very flavorful with a perfect crust. Rotating crafy beer list some local others from all around but no commercial not I saw. I had two stout beers Odell's Russian Pirate, too sweet for my taste and Great Divide Yeti which was just what I like, strong and bitter.

Back to the Phoenix area and had to try more good food here.  Had a great pizza (that's what they are known for) 1/2 price on Mondays - yum.  Also a walnut pear salad enough to make three meals for me.  The waitress was charming - from Seattle no less!

I have been coming here for many years but I must say this place is getting kind of grimy as time goes on... It's bordering on dive bar status. The food is decent and the service is always good and everyone is friendly but please for the love of God give this place a deep cleaning because it's getting really gross and grimy... Has staff ever gone into the bathrooms? The restrooms for example! Cracked mirrors, disgusting years and years accumulation of dust and grime in the exhaust fan cover in the ceiling, grossness all around the toilet and the fixtures and just a general obvious sense that there is no cleaning service here and none of the bar staff going to give a shit about cleaning a restroom. The Point is: if your restrooms are that disgusting what does It have to say about your kitchen, about your tap lines, etc.
Their food is average. I do like their Cesar Salads. The have good wings too. Lots of bears on tap and nice outdoors/pub ambiance. This is a nice watering hole to hang out with friends.

New favorite Tempe bar!  I can't believe it has taken me so long to get to Boulders.  Badass beer selection. Badass drink specials!  I love bars that have daily specials. I would say Thursdays at Boulders are the best... 1/2 off almost all bottles of beer!  *But make sure you look at your tab because the bartender forgot to take of the 50% at first*  It is quite packed with a college crowd but falls into the lines of a 'Casey Moores' more than Mill Ave etc.    Have really great Trivia there on Tuesdays! Its a big place with ample seating and cheap drinks but the best part is that you can bring dogs on the outside patio.  I don't know any other bar that allows dogs on their patio! Its fantastic! Yay Boulders!!!!

Was there last Sunday with a large group.  Apparently they were phoned ahead to let them know that 50 people would be showing up to eat, drink and spend money.  After getting a beer we never saw the waitress again for 30 minutes.  At that point she took food orders for about 1/2 of the folks at my table, missing me and probably 5 others.  She disappeared again, returning 30 minutes later.  About this time I went to the bar to get another beer and the first bartender (and they weren't busy) basically turned his back on me.  The second one did serve me.  Another 30 minutes later, now tired of this, tracked down the waitress, settled my tab and walked out.  Bottom line the servers were overwhelmed.  I don't think I'll be back.

Love this neighborhood spot.  Great place to go to enjoy some good food (bar foods), and drinks.  They have a wide selection of beers to choose from and are very knowledgeable about them.  The staff is super friendly and attentive.   My favorite menu item..."The Big Freaking Nachos", a delicious twist on nachos.  Made with fried wonton chips, crumbled Italian sausage, pepperoni slices, peppers, and melted cheese.  YUM!  Don't expect anything fancy in terms of ambiance, it's a hipster hang out, very eclectic.

Great place to grab a pint or bottle of beer. Their range and selection is quite impressive and is constantly changing. There are usually craft beer related events going on a couple of times a month that are truly epic. Recently I have been there for a tap takeover and a Beer for Brains event that were top notch.  Thursday night is my favorite...1/2 price bottles of beer. You can really do some damage for not a lot of money on some awesome craft beer. If you live in the area, this is a perfect place to ride your bike to for some brews.  There is some pretty fierce competition for team trivia on Saturday nights, but I secretly think that there are some cheating teams upstairs. No one is checking them. Maybe I'm just bitter for coming in second place, but still.

Amazing beer selection with a great eclectic "bar food" menu.  The pear quesadilla and the hard day pizza were exquisite!  The bartender, Chris, was one of the most knowledgeable beer enthusiasts I've ever met.

Could be great but is always just lacking, but for many people it must do the job for them because during prime time hours this place is usually annoying overcrowded.   Seats at the bar itself are scarce. Service is inconsistent as some of their staff is happy to be there, while others seem to hate their job & dislike that fact that you're their making them work.   Without question, beer selection is the star of Boulders. The tap selection is wide & consistently rotates with fresh & diverse offerings. The food is mediocre & average for a bar & grill. It's kind of a jack of all trades, master of none approach to the menu with burgers, tacos, pizza, pasta.   Coming here to watch some sports might be seem to be a good idea, but the seat & screen placement creates some challenges for enjoying a sporting event.   Lastly, turn down the lighting in this place. It's awkwardly bright, bars shouldnt have lighting that makes you feel like you're at target or walmart. Pints, friends, & dim lighting make for a fantastic combination.

This place is pretty awesome for lunch. We ordered a pizza, and a few beers. The have over 20+ on tap.  The press was much better than i thought the beer was great, the service is commendable, the actual restaurant/bar is clean and well maintained as well as the dining area. It shows was pleasant, polite, suggested a really good bet, and want over bearing. Overall i plan to come back here again, and would recommend this place any day.

stupendous beer selection and food was awesome as well and open late. what else do you need to know?  and umm they have hummus( good hummus) so automatic thumbs up in my book.   you will see me  checking in here.   over n out.

We were looking something fun to do on a Tuesday night and found out they do trivia nights on Tuesdays and have 1/2 priced apps. We ordered the bruschetta, guacamole, and a couple of drafts.  Trivia game was well organized and not to hard which was great.  I use a scoring system that is based off a 1-5 scale with a 3 meeting expectations.  I do a category score for the food, staff, and venue.  The total average score is reflected in the yelp review stars  FOOD 3.75 5-Service / Speed  3-Overall Taste  3-Plating / Look 4-Menu Variety  STAFF 3.25 4-Attentiveness 4-Friendliness  5-Menu knowledge   VENUE 3.5  4-Atmosphere 4-Cleanliness 3-Location 3-Feel

Went on a Sunday night for trivia with a large group. The service was slightly slow, good atmosphere and pretty laid back. The place is pretty spacious overall with ample parking and outdoor seating as well. The beer list was missing a lot of my favorites so I tried out about 4 beers from their list. I wasn't necessarily impressed by any of them. The food was okay. I would definitely go back for trivia but not because of the food or beer. Good environment though.

Solid 3.5 stars rounded up.   A mood struck me, it was last minute.  I needed to get out to some place new.  So I sent a text to Anna M and we decided to meet in her neck of the woods.  A quick Yelp search put this place at the top of our list.    Parking was packed.  I had to park in the lot next door.  There were several folks on the patio. As we walked in we were greeted by a large indoor bike rack.  Pretty neat! We claimed 2 empty seats at the bar and the server let us know that they had Happy Hour all day during the weekend, the beers with the * were $1 off and sandwiches were $6.  Ohhh nice deal!   As we looked through the menu we also noticed they offer all you can eat 1-topping pizza for $7 on Sundays. We agreed we needed to come back on a Sunday to check this place out.  Once we realized they also do Pub Trivia nights we also agreed we needed to come back for that too.  In fact much of the crowd on this night was here for the Pub Trivia so much so that within an hour after it was over this place emptied by more than half.   The food and service were quality.  We decided to split the honey chicken sandwich with waffle fries.  A little cheese, bacon, lettuce, tomato, onion and pickle. The chicken breast was grilled and was thick and moist.  The 2 of us with 2 good beers each and sharing a sandwich came out to about $30 including tip.
A little divey, but in a good way. Food is pretty decent and a good selection of beers. What's not to like?

Boulders is great I go to see Chris and Justin, I live in the neighborhood which is great since you can bring your dog to the patio.   The deep dish pizza is top notch and they always have top shelf beers on tap.   Trivia is held on Sundays.

Been going to Boulders nearly every week since moving to Arizona, and unfortunately this place has taken a nose dive lately. Amazing beer selection, great food, but absolutely awful staff. It was my favorite bar in Tempe for quite awhile, but I'll go elsewhere now to not have to deal with the uninterested and often times belligerent staff. Bummer to see what the workers have done to this place, because it wasn't always like this.

I have been many restaurant and never been to this one. The owner and staffs are super friendly. I was having trouble with online order through yelp. It was end up a disaster through it. When we drive to the restaurant and thought the food was ready to pick up apparently it was not even there.  The staff talked to the owner there. The owner put the order in for us right away.  That is the great satisfied customer service. I called build my own burger, it is really good with fries. also, i order the tangy traditional chicken wings. My sister order grill chicken burger and she say really good. I would recommend this place to anyone who's visit Phoenix Arizona.

Fun little place in Tempe with some decent beer selection and tasty food.  I had a blue cheese burger and waffle fries. Delicious.  Service was good when we were here. It's bit divey inside, I think it used to be a Denny's or Sizzler or something.  The crowd appeared to be mostly college and/or hipsters.

I have been to Boulders twice, once a few years ago for trivia night (can't really judge the place, just had a beer) and for a party a couple weeks ago. The definite pro of this place was the service. They were very accommodating to our large party, even gave us our own party room without a reservation or anything. Our waiter for the party had an incredible memory and handled about 30 different orders and bills... pretty impressive. The drinks here were fine, nothing to write home about, but not bad. I got to try a few different food items, the artichoke dip, a couple of the quesadillas, and pepperoni wheel. None of the food was anything I would go back for. The best thing was the hot sauce with the southwest quesadilla. As impressed as I was with the service, I wouldn't rush back here any time soon.

Boulders probably has the most extensive collection of draft micro-brews in the area. They're constantly rotating through only the best beers and always have plenty to offer in the high-hopped varieties, which tend to be my favorites -- from Dogfish IPA to Stone to Bell's Two Hearted Ale.  The service here is also excellent, both at the bar and at the tables. For a college town, the scene is pretty diverse. There are plenty of early twenties hipsters and hipsterettes but I've never felt like I was the only person over 30 here.  The thin crust pizza is also quite excellent. I always order it extra crispy and it's consistently done right. I'm not too sure about the other menu items yet.   If you like a relaxed atmosphere, really good beer, and tasty pizza, give Boulders on Broadway a try!

Rogue Dead Guy Maibock, Pepperoni Wheels, and Team Trivia. The rest is kinda irrelevant.  The beer list is absurdly good, the food is cheap and delicious, and the music is kept at levels that are pleasing to the senses while staying conversation friendly.  I expected Boulders to be a college bar but there were plenty of Oldy Olsens like myself hanging out and enjoying the fine spirits and Team Trivia. The wide range of affable, good-looking peeps was really a nice surprise.  The only criticism I can offer up here is the state of the men's bathroom, which was a disaster area. Really, really, gross. But I'm a dude, so whatever.  Boulders isn't in my 'hood but it's definitely worth the drive.
Shockingly bad food and service. We were with a private paryt upstairs so maybe that was the reason for agonizingly slow service but there's zero chance of me returning.

Great craft beer selection!  The staff is very knowledgeable staff on the beer selections and always friendly. Food.. not so good.  Typical soso bar food. Atmosphere ok but pretty tired and dated. Overall a relaxed bar with great beer and reasonable prices.

This place is always so dang good. Such great specials, delicious food and awesome beer!! Here quite often and it always impresses me. The music doesn't really fit but that's okay, the food, people and beer.. Make up for it! Get on down here and get the moose drool burger and spicy hot pickles! Yum

I had the southwest turkey sandwich which had Turkey, sweet roasted red peppers, southwest sauce and pepper jack cheese. Topped with mixed greens and avocado....it was soooooooo good.  I couldn't eat all of it...very filling.  The waffle fries were really good, well seasoned.  Next time I will have to have a beer!

Great food, good service, and an excellent laid back atmosphere. It's a perfect place to get a drink or share a meal whether it be for a night cap or a random Wednesday night outing. You can just go in, seat yourself, and ask the friendly server their beer recommendations.

If you love amazing music, come out to Boulders On Broadway.  They love their music so loud, they'll crank the speakers to ELEVEN!  Why I loved Boulders On Broadway before Upstairs Comedy: -Delicious hamburgers -Plenty of different beers on tap -A fine selection of games -Cool atmosphere -Friendly bartenders  You can finish reading if you don't care to read about how Boulders missed out on a big opportunity to be a great place for stand-up comedy.  When I was here back in May, this was a cool place to hang out with friends.  We played Jenga, drank, ate food, drank, watched sports, drank, and did some more drinking.  I had a good time.  Later that month, I started doing stand-up comedy on May 28th.  Two months later, comedy consumed me.  I caught the comedy bug and I wanted to get better, but there weren't enough true open-mic nights to work out new material where you can just go sign up and get on stage.  When I first heard Boulders was going to let us riff upstairs, I thought it was a dream come true.  To perform at Boulders, you didn't have to book yourself to get on the show, nor did you have to sacrifice your time to be one of the first ten people to show up or you didn't get to do comedy.  It was an open mic at its purest form.  And it was worth the thirty minute drive to get there too.  When we first started this, we were welcomed with arms wide opened.  The staff were very nice to us for providing waters for everyone and were very accommodating.  There are a few degenerates in our social circle, but that goes with any group of people.  That's no reason to treat us with less hospitality...like blaring music to accommodate only three people hanging out downstairs on a Sunday night, when there are more people trying to get better at comedy upstairs.  By drowning us out with your music and making our show less enjoyable, the show in general drew fewer audience members.  It was progressively getting less and less of a credible open mic night and more of a colossal waste of time.    I understand you don't like it when broke comedians are thrifty in withhold from spending money on your food and beverages, but most of us were at least trying to scrape out our piggy bank savings for food and alcohol to keep you fire-breathing dragons happy for us giving back to Boulders.  But that just wasn't enough to keep you from playing music on full-blast with your passive aggression towards our craft.  This is like writing a letter to an unrequited love and it is bringing tears to my eyes writing this.  We really wanted this to work, but this was a failed experiment on both ends.  I hope one day we can do a comedy show here again for old times sake, and I hope I can forget about this so I can return to the good old days at Boulders.  Thank you for the good times and I can't recommend this place enough to music lovers.

I saw all of the great reviews and decided to stop in.  Nice laid back spot. Happy hour is 3-7. I arrived at 6:50 and had my food and drinks by 7. The beer selection is awesome! I had the Great Divide: Hercules Double IPA and the Belching Beaver: Phantom Bride IPA. I also ordered the fried zucchini and Mexican nachos. The nachos were good but the zucchini was great! Definitely recommend trying them. The jukebox played a variety of music. There's TVs everywhere with sports on. Service is wonderful. They also have random specials everyday of the week.   Overall, great atmosphere, good food, and great service. Definitely recommend this place.

If you are looking for a standard bar to hang out with friends, you will find what you are looking for here.  Food is regular (I ate their pizza and wings), decor is blah - some areas definitely need to be updated.  In general, nothing about this place stands out to me as great or somewhere that I'd want to revisit.  But again, if you are looking for a bar to hang with friends you could do worse than here....

This is now my go to spot. Service is out of this world! Every sever remembers your name and has no problem explaining anything on the menu. The food is also top notch. I loved everything I have tried! The beer on tap is always changing and they have something for every palate! I will definitely be returning often

Came here late one night after an event in Phoenix, to have a few drinks and snacks.  The nachos on the won ton chips are delightful and very different then anything I've ever had.  I absolutely loved them!
$20 minimum on delivery. Way too high when considering other delivery options in the area. (In a college town. lol)

Oh. My. God. I seriously have never had better bar food (completely sober). The service was awesome, our waiter made me laugh every time he stopped by; he wasn't limited to jokes but branched into sarcasm and story telling and I was almost in tears at a couple points. The food was excellent. I got a calzone and shared nachos with my wife, and they absolutely nailed it. Overall this place is arguably one of my favorite restaurants ever, and I will recommend to everyone, always.

A ski-lodgey pizzeria. This says it all. Well, almost. While the decor may be a bit "weird" and "puzzling," make no bones about it, the beer selection is great.  Let's re-cap 2 of my experiences, shall we?  DINNER:  Arrived shortly after 6 p.m. on a Saturday and sat in the bar area, which was littered with a few patrons. Live music started at 7 p.m. Since Saturday is considered "All Day Happy Hour," I went with a $5 sandwich - turkey, with smoked provolone. On the side, fresh fruit. They call this their "Half and Half." The sandwich was okay. Nothing I can't make at my own hacienda, though. I really liked the turkey, which like appeared freshly carved. The beverage: Sam Adams Summer ale, which was their seasonal at the time.   My family, who dined with me, thought the food was okay. When both my brother and my dad ordered beef, they weren't asked what temperature they wanted it cooked at. They were just given it well done. I would not have stood for that.   Overall, the food is average "bar style" food. The menu is large, though. It may take you several minutes to narrow down your choices. From calzones and burgers to sammies, you have options.   JUST DRINKS:  Now we're talking. If you're looking for a low-key place to hang for a couple hours, play some pool, watch some sports or hear live music, I would suggest checking out this place. They have two pools tables: one downstairs in the bar area; one upstairs. They also have a video game machine at the bar. (Beware that the pool tables were probably bequeathed to this place. After all, balls disappear. Where did the que ball go? Hmm.)  As for the beer, well... Let's just say they have quite the selection. You may not find your fancy imports here, but you will find some really great beers from some Oregon and Colorado microbrews. For that, this place goes up in rating for me (hence the 4 stars). After all, there's not may low-key places 'round town - especially close to home - that offer quite the array of beers to satiate my discerning tastes. I recommend you try The Great Divide Raspberry Ale, which is made with real raspberries. It's not overly sweet, but it's unique enough that you may find yourself, like me, craving it from time to time. Or, if you enjoy Rogue beer, they do sell the Dead Guy Ale on tap!   Sure, I list out their beers here, but that'll take up my entire character limit. Let's just say that on their drink menu, THREE WHOLE PAGES are devoted to beer - what you'll find both on tap and by the bottle.   SO WHY GO?  Uhm, that's easy. Go for the great beer. (That's the main reason for the 4-star rating.)  If you love good beer, like I do, and want to chill with some friends, while playing pool or listening to some live jams (though the live music stopped at 9 when i went), then check out Boulders on Broadway.
