You may even find yourself thinking you stumbled through an invisible portal into a 1970's Denver ski lodge. Good times!

Remember McDowell's in the movie "Coming to America" with Eddie Murphy?  They had the same menu and practices, but it was McDowell's and not McDonald's.  Same here.  This Old Chicago was converted to Boulders on Broadway, but the menu is virtually a clone menu of the Old C menu with the same options, nearly idenitcal prices, and on some occasions I swear it's the same images.  Tap selections good though, and the craft beer enthusiast will be happy here.  It's always great to see Dogfish Head on tap (90 minute).  It has a dive feel to it inside, as it is often rather dark and gloomy in feel.  Seems to have a few regular alcoholics too, but what local bar doesn't?

First time here and beer selection was good. Had the pizza rolls and have to say those were pretty tasty, nachos on the other hand were a bit dry and asked for pico to be on the side and they added it anyways . All in all I have it 4 and will be back

We have been here many times but this was the first time for Sunday football breakfast. We lucked out with the best bar staff ever - friendly and helpful when we couldn't decide. Great selection of beer on tap and the rotating selections are phenomenal. Bloody Mary was a bit on the spicy side - but most people loved it. Breakfast was good - the sweet potato tots were crispy crunchy delicious, bacon was well... bacon. Egg dishes were cooked to perfection. Aside from the rude Bears fan near us, it was a great morning at Boulders on Broadway. Love the bike rack too!

2 stars since we've had better experiences here, but this was crazy. Our waiter smelled like booze and messed up again and again and again: forgetting our drink order, bringing the wrong drinks TWICE, forgetting one drink altogether (our daughter I s too young to speak up so we didn't realize it till after we left), etc. The cheeseburger arrived without cheese on it, one order was delivered with stuff missing, and another person's order never got put in at all. (Waiter blamed the kitchen and claimed it got burned but we didn't buy it.) We did get comped the forgotten order, which finally arrived maybe half an hour later. Every single person of the five at our table had our orders messed up in some way at least once.   We've had mediocre service there a few times before, but this was too much. Food was ok and the manager is cool, but the waiter was obviously wasted.

My husband and I didn't get a chance to eat before we went to a play in Mesa. Nothing was open for food in downtown so I checked on Yelp for someplace still serving food. This place came up on the list and we were close so went to give it a try. The servers and bartenders were very friendly. They had a nice menu with lots of options. We decided to just go for the hamburgers.  They were really good and we chose their homemade potato chips which were also good. The server said three pizza is very good so I would like to go back and try it. It is nice to know there are places like this for late dining and I would recommend it. Luckily, we missed the football crowd from the Arizona game tonight or we wouldn't have been able to get in.

This review is specifically about their food tent at the Tour de Fat. I bought a whole pepperoni pizza from Boulders on Broadway. It was extremely blah. The standard thickness crust had the flavor interest of Wonder Bread. The sause was barely noticeable. The only thing to add any flavor was the few pepperoni on each slice. I love pizza, however, this flavorless pizza barely meets the definition. I will never order this item again.

I didn't even make it inside... that is just how wonderful the patio is. I grabbed a table near several groups of really friendly locals, artists, musicians, students, all who gathered for great burgers and even greater brews. The beer menu changes often so they even have an app for your phone that updates what's on tap here. The burger I ordered and salad my friend had were both fantastic and the ambiance outside is great if you like the local, artsy feel with friendly staff and customers.
Love this place! It's comfortable, the food is consistently great & the beer selection is always tasty. Jason & Matt are both awesome guys, too!

I had heard about this spot from various people yet I had never tried it. They have awesome happy hour deals. Weekly from 3-7pm & then a reverse happy hour special from 9-Close! They have a wide variety of foods to choose from. From appetizers such as jalapeno tots, italian nachos, to lunch, dinner & salads. The service was great! The waitress was extremely helpful & nice & even let me sample the Honey Ace Cider! It was delicious. I recommend this place to anyone who is looking for a chill spot. They even have outdoor covered patio seating & a fireplace outside for cold nights!
